scene.description: [Marvel Opening Credits]
[Radio transmission sound]

[The Marvel Studios Logo plays as usual but this time, at the end of that logo, the background changes from red to black and the I and O in "Studios" become 10 in red. The logo now reads "Marvel Studios". Throughout the logo, an Asgardian is reporting a distress signal.] Asgardian PA: This is the Asgardian refugee vessel Statesman. We are under assault, I repeat, we are under assault - The engines are dead, life support failing. Requesting aid from any vessel within range. We are 22 jump points out of Asgard. [The voice becomes more desperate and pleading] Our crew is made up of Asgardian families, we have very few soldiers here. This is not a warcraft. I repeat, this is not a warcraft! [The ship is being hit by missiles.]

[Inside the ship, Ebony Maw walks among the bodies of dead Asgardians. Heimdall, badly wounded, reaches out as if he would stop Maw as he passes, but lacks the strength. Maw steps over them with no mind as he speaks, as if they were scattered pieces of dirty clothing on a bedroom floor.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: Hear me, and rejoice. You have had the privilege of being saved by the Great Titan.... You may think this is suffering... no. It is salvation. Universal scales tip toward balance because of your sacrifice. Smile... [Corvus Glaive stabs one of the lingering Asgardians] for even in death, you have become Children of Thanos.

scene.description: [Loki stands with the Black Order. He watches Thanos, shrouded in darkness and light, a vague silhouette.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Looking out the large window we saw at the end of Thor: Ragnarok] I know what it's like to lose. To feel so desperately that you're right... yet to fail, nonetheless. [Lifts Thor by the neck of his breastplate. Thor struggles feebly.] It's frightening. Turns the legs to jelly. I ask you, to what end? Dread it. Run from it. Destiny arrives all the same. And now, it's here. Or should I say... I AM.

scene.description: [Thanos holds up his hand to reveal the Infinity Gauntlet, which already hosts the violet Power Stone.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Now being held by Thanos with one huge hand wrapping around his head; blood drools from his mouth] You talk too much.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [To Loki] The Tesseract, or your brother's head. I assume you have a preference.

scene.description: [The Black Order heft their weapons or smirks, as appropriate.]

dialogue.speaker: Loki
dialogue.line: Oh, I do. Kill away!

scene.description: [Thanos' face expresses surprise briefly before presses the gauntlet to Thor's left temple. The Power Stone glows brightly. Thor screams hoarsely.]

dialogue.speaker: Loki
dialogue.line: [Starts losing his cool demeanor almost immediately as Thor suffers, and breaks after only a few moments] ALL RIGHT, STOP!

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: We don't have the Tesseract. It was destroyed on Asgard.

scene.description: [Loki glances at Thor like he knows something he doesn't. He lifts his right hand into the air and the Tesseract reveals itself.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: You really are the worst brother.

dialogue.speaker: Loki
dialogue.line: [While holding the Tesseract out to Thanos and advancing] I assure you, brother... the sun will shine on us again.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Your optimism is misplaced, Asgardian.

dialogue.speaker: Loki
dialogue.line: Well, for one thing, I'm not Asgardian. And for another... we have a Hulk.

scene.description: [Thanos looks to his right just as a green and very angry mass slams into him. Loki dives for Thor, pulling both of them out of the way as the Tesseract skitters across the floor, and the Hulk charges Thanos. The Hulk pummels Thanos, forcing him backwards and shoving him into the wall of the ship. Maw stops Cull Obsidian from interfering.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: Let him have his fun.

scene.description: [Thanos pries the Hulk's hands away; an expression of surprise and fear crosses his green face. After several hard blows, Thanos picks up the Hulk and slams him to the deck, defeated. Thor slams a metal bar across Thanos' back to no avail, is kicked across the deck by Thanos and is promptly bound in metal debris by Ebony Maw to keep him from interfering further.]

dialogue.speaker: Heimdall
dialogue.line: [Prays] Allfathers… let the dark magic flow through me one last... time.

scene.description: [Heimdall summons the Bifrost, which carries the Hulk away; he meets Thor's eye.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: That was a mistake.

scene.description: [Thanos borrows Corvus's glaive and stabs Heimdall through the heart, twisting the blade in the wound.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: NO!!! [After Thanos kills Heimdall] You're going to die for that!

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: [Shuts Thor's mouth with his telekinesis] Shh.

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: [Kneels before Thanos, offering up the Tesseract] My humble personage… bows before your grandeur. No other being has ever had the might, nay the nobility, to wield not one, but two Infinity Stones. The universe lies within your grasp.

scene.description: [Thanos crushes the Tesseract, revealing the blue Space Stone. He blows some of the fractals away, fingering the Stone between his thumb and index, before placing it on the gauntlet, and is momentarily rocked by the surge of energy that pulses as the stone seats in its setting.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: There are two more Stones on Earth. Find them, my children, and bring them to me on Titan.

dialogue.speaker: Proxima Midnight
dialogue.line: [Kneeling] Father, we will not fail you.

dialogue.speaker: Cull Obsidian
dialogue.line: We're going to New York City and We will tear The Avengers Apart and Smash! Once and for all, my lord.

dialogue.speaker: Loki
dialogue.line: [Emerging from behind the Black Order] [cheerfully] If I might interject… if you're going to Earth, you might want a guide. I do have a bit of experience in that arena.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Unimpressed] If you consider failure experience.

dialogue.speaker: Loki
dialogue.line: I consider experience, experience. Almighty Thanos, I... Loki... Prince of Asgard... [looks significantly at Thor] Odinson... the rightful King of Jotunheim... God of Mischief... do hereby pledge to you, my undying fidelity.

scene.description: [Thor squints and notices a dagger materialize in Loki's hand. Loki braces himself, thrusts upward with lightning speed and attempts to stab Thanos, but is frozen in place by the Space Stone's power before the point could strike home.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: "Undying?" You should choose your words more carefully.

scene.description: [Thanos twists the dagger out of Loki's hand with his right hand, then takes hold of Loki's neck with the gauntlet and lifts him to eye level. Loki struggles, kicking, as his throat is squeezed. He makes eye contact with Thor before he increases his force on Loki's neck.]

dialogue.speaker: Loki
dialogue.line: [Giving up on fighting against Thanos] You will... never be... a god. [Thanos crushes Loki's neck, killing him.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Muffled] NO!

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Walks over and drops Loki's body in front of Thor.] No resurrections this time.

scene.description: [Thanos raises the gauntlet, sends violet Power fire through the remains of the Statesman, and uses the Space Stone to teleport away with the Black Order.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: No… Loki….

scene.description: [Thor is released from his bonds. He crawls over to Loki's body -- which, unlike in The Dark World, has not returned to its Jotun form -- and lays his head down on Loki's chest, shedding tears for all that he has lost. The ship explodes.]
[The Bifrost continues its journey, bringing the Hulk across space to Earth.]
[Sanctum Sanctorum, New York City]
[Doctor Strange, Master of the Mystic Arts, proceeds down the main steps of the Sanctum with Wong.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Dressed in casual American clothes.] Seriously? You don't have any money?

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: [Dressed as Wong is always dressed.] Attachment to the material is detachment from the spiritual.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: I'll tell the guys at the deli. [Wryly] Maybe they'll make you a metaphysical ham on rye.

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: Oh, wait, wait, wait, I think I have 200.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Dollars?

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: Rupees.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Which is?

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: Uh, buck and a half.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: What do you want?

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: I wouldn't say no to a tuna melt.

scene.description: [Bruce crash-lands through the Sanctum stairs. The Cloak of Levitation swirls around Strange's shoulders immediately.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Thanos is coming. He's coming...

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Sharing a look with Wong, and now fully in his mage attire] Who?

scene.description: [Title Screen: Avengers: Infinity War]
[Public Park, New York City, day. Tony Stark and Pepper Potts walk on having a conversation.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Slow down, slow down. I'm totally not kidding.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: [Laughing slightly and talking over him] You're totally rambling.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Also talking over her] No, I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Lost me.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Look, you know how you're having a dream, and in the dream you gotta pee?

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Okay, and then you're like, 'Oh my god, there's no bathroom, what am I gonna do?', 'Oh! Someone's watching,' ''m gonna go in my pants.'

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Right. And then you wake up, and in real life you actually have to pee.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Yeah. Everybody has that.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Right! That's the point I'm trying to make. Apropos of that, last night, I dreamt, we had a kid. So real. We named him after your eccentric uncle. Uh, what was his name?

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: [Nodding in understanding] Right.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Morgan! Morgan.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: So you woke up, and thought that we were...

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Expecting.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Becoming excited] Yes?

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: [Shaking her head] No.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: I had a dream about it. It was so real.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: If you wanted to have a kid, you wouldn't have done that.

scene.description: [Pepper unties his jacket sleeves and taps Tony's chest attachment.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: I'm glad you brought this up, 'cause it's nothing. It's just a housing unit for nano particles.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: It's not helping your case, OK?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: No, no, it's an attachment, it's not a-

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: [Insistently] You don't need that.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: I know. I had the surgery. I'm just trying to protect us. The future uses, and that's it. Just in case there's a monster in the closet, instead of, you know...

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Shirts?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: You know me so well. You finish all my sentences.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: You should have shirts in your closet.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yeah. You know what there should be? No more surprises. We're gonna have a nice dinner tonight. Show off this Harry Win-stone. Right? And we should have no more surprises. Ever. I should promise you.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: I will. [Tony kisses Pepper.]

scene.description: [Doctor Strange comes through a portal.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Tony Stark, I'm Doctor Stephen Strange. I need you to come with me. Oh, uh, congratulations on the wedding, by the way.

scene.description: [Tony and Pepper are understandably shocked.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: I'm sorry, you giving out tickets or something?

scene.description: Stephen Strange:We need your help. Look, it's not overselling to say that the fate of the universe is at stake.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: And who's "we"?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Emerges from behind Doctor Strange] Hey, Tony.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Looking surprised] Bruce.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Pepper.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: You okay?

scene.description: [Bruce gives Tony a desperate hug, not answering. After everything he has been through, we understand.]
[Back at the Sanctum Sanctorum.]

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: [Using magic to show the universe and five out of six Infinity Stones.] From the dawn of the universe, there was nothing. Then, boom! The Big Bang sent six elemental crystals, hurtling across the virgin universe. These Infinity Stones each control an essential aspect of existence.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Each Stone lights up as Dr. Strange names them.] Space. Reality. Power. Soul. Mind. And Time.

scene.description: [Dr. Strange opens the Eye of Agamotto, revealing the Time Stone emitting emerald light.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Very attentive] Tell me his name again.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Thanos. He's a plague, Tony. He invades planets. He takes what he wants. He wipes out half the population. He sent Loki. The attack on New York. That's him.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Speaking to himself] This is it... What's our timeline?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: No telling. He has the Power and Space Stones, that already makes him the strongest creature in the whole universe. If he gets his hands, on all six Stones, Tony...

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: He can destroy life on a scale hitherto undreamt of.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Leans against a cauldron, stretching like he's about to go for a run.] Did you seriously just say "hitherto undreamt of"?

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Are you seriously leaning on the Cauldron of the Cosmos?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Is that what this is.... ?

scene.description: [The Cloak of Levitation smacks Tony's arm, surprising him.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Looking offended] [Straightening himself] I'm going to allow that. If Thanos needs all six, why don't we just stick this one down the garbage disposal?

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: No can do.

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: We swore an oath to protect the Time Stone. With our lives.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: And I swore off dairy, but then, Ben & Jerry's named a flavor after me, so....

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Stark Raving Hazelnuts.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: It's not bad.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: A bit chalky.

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: A Hunka-Hulka Burning Fudge is our favorite.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: That's a thing?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Whatever. Point is: things change.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Our oath to protect the Time Stone cannot change. This Stone may be the best chance we have against Thanos.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: And still conversely, it may also be his best chance against us.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Well, if we don't do our jobs.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Slightly condescending] What is your job exactly, besides making balloon animals?

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Completely calm] Protecting your reality, douchebag.

scene.description: [You seriously can't tell who's sarcasm is better.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Okay, guys, could we table this discussion right now? The fact is that we have this Stone. We know where it is. Vision is out there somewhere with the Mind Stone, and we have to find him now.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Awkwardly] Yeah, that's the... thing.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Two weeks ago, Vision turned off his transponder. He's offline.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: What? Tony, you lost another super bot?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: I didn't lose him. He's more than that. He's evolving.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Who could find Vision, then?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Quietly to himself] Shit. [To the other men in a normal tone] Probably Steve Rogers.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Sighing in exasperation] Oh, great.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Maybe. But... [Sighs]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Missing the events of the Avengers' Civil War] Call him.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: It's not that easy. God, we haven't caught up in a spell, have we?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: No.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: The Avengers broke up. We're toast.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Rather surprised and slightly let-down] Broke up? Like a band? Like The Beatles?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Cap and I fell out hard. We're not on speaking terms.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Almost pleading] Tony, listen to me. Thor's gone. Thanos is coming. It doesn't matter who you're talking to or not.

scene.description: [Tony hesitates, before pulling out the cellular phone Steve mailed him, muttering 'flip phone'. It seems as though he brings it everywhere, always ready to call his lost friend. Before clicking "Call", he pauses, distracted by an unusual rumbling.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Say, Doc, you wouldn't happen to be moving your hair, would you?

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Looking up at his forelock fluttering] Not at the moment, no.

scene.description: [Tony looks at the Hulk-made opening through the ceiling and sees debris flying by outside. He exits the Sanctum through the front door and scans the chaotic surroundings, the camera shaking around in this following long take to illustrate the chaos -- people running and screaming in alarm, traffic becoming impossibly tangled, a litter-filled wind like a nor'easter's. A woman falls nearly at his feet and he helps her up.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: You okay?

scene.description: [The woman ignores him and runs away. A car crashes in on a pole behind Tony.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Help him! Wong, Doc.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Go! Got it!

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Putting on his sunglasses] F.R.I.D.A.Y., what am I looking at?

dialogue.speaker: F.R.I.D.A.Y.
dialogue.line: Not sure, I'm working on it.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Hey! You might wanna put that Time Stone in your back pocket, Doc!

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Bands of spells are readied around his forearms] Might wanna use it.

scene.description: [A mechanical hum grows louder as Tony approaches the intersection. As he turns the corner, he sees a huge circular ship floating over Bleecker Street.]
[On a school bus, the hairs on Peter Parker's arms stand up. He looks out the window and sees the ship.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: [Tapping his best friend in the seat in front of him] Ned, hey. I need you to cause a distraction.

dialogue.speaker: Ned Leeds
dialogue.line: [Turns around and sees the spaceship] Holy shit! We're all gonna die! There's a spaceship!

scene.description: [Students scramble to the windows in the back to see the spaceship.]
[Peter quickly slides on one of his Stark-made webshooters, and webs the emergency exit lever on the opposite side of the bus.]

dialogue.speaker: School Bus Driver, Stan Lee
dialogue.line: What's the matter with you kids? You've never seen a spaceship before?

scene.description: [Peter jumps out the window, clinging to the side of the bus and pulling on his mask before leaping over the side of the bridge, shooting a web-line and swinging free. He makes his way hastily towards the ship.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: F.R.I.D.A.Y., evac anyone south of 43rd Street, notify first responders.

dialogue.speaker: F.R.I.D.A.Y.
dialogue.line: Will do.

scene.description: [Doctor Strange throws the Winds of Watoomb over Bleeker Street, and winks at Tony. The dust clears. Tony is begrudgingly amused for a split second.]
[Then Ebony Maw and Cull Obsidian exit the ship by transmat.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: Hear me, and rejoice. You are about to die at the hands of the Children of Thanos. Be thankful, that your meaningless lives are now contributing to...

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Echoing the familiarly defiant 2008 Tony Stark] I'm sorry, Earth is closed today. You better pack it up and get outta here.

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: [Looks at Doctor Strange] Stonekeeper... [Gestures to Tony] Does this chattering animal speak for you?

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Certainly not. I speak for myself. [Magical shields are readied with his fists, stepping forward.] But you’re trespassing in this city and on this planet. [Wong emulates him.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: It means get lost, Squidward!

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: He exhausts me.

dialogue.speaker: Cull Obsidian
dialogue.line: [Two untranslated syllables]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: Bring me the Stone.

dialogue.speaker: Cull Obsidian
dialogue.line: [Three untranslated syllables] [He drops his huge alien hammer and drags it along as he obeys his brethren.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Banner, you want a piece?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: No, not really, but when do I ever get what I want?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: That's right.

scene.description: [Bruce attempts to release the Hulk. Instead of Hulk coming out easily, the most that turns green is Bruce's neck.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Been a while. Good to have you, buddy.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: I just... I need to concentrate here for one second. Come on, come on, man.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Where's your guy?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: I don't know. We've sort been havin' a thing.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: There's no time for a thing.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: I know.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Points at the approaching Obsidian] That's the thing right there. Let's go.

scene.description: [Bruce gives out a loud grunt, but fails to release the Hulk. Doctor Strange stares at Tony and Bruce in disbelief.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Glances at Doctor Strange] Dude, you're embarrassing me in front of the wizards.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Tony, I'm sorry. [Stammers] Either I can't or he won't--

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: It's okay. Hey, stand down. [to Wong] Keep an eye on him. Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: I have him.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Damn it.

scene.description: [As Cull Obsidian approaches the team, Tony dons his nanotech Iron Man suit in the space of three steps. He grows a shield on one arm to protect himself, then grows a set of blasters that easily throw the Dwarf back to Maw, who gestures and deflects his massive companion into some cars.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Where'd that come from?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: It's nano-tech. You like it? A little someth--

scene.description: [Ebony Maw creates a spike of earth that throws Iron Man far up, and attacks the rest of the team with uprooted trees and other debris. Wong summons the Shield of the Seraphim.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Dr. Banner, if the rest of your green friend won't be joining us....

scene.description: [Doctor Strange teleports Bruce to a nearby park along with half a taxi. Iron Man returns and joins the fight, pushing a car thrown by Maw back at him. Maw cuts it in half and lets the pieces fly past him, untouched.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Gotta get that stone outta here, now.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: It stays with me.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Exactly. Bye.

scene.description: [Iron Man flies through Ebony Maw's obstacle course but is cut short by Cull Obsidian's hammer, sending him through a building and into the park at high speed, plowing into the ground and fetching up against a tree.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Rushing over to Iron Man] Tony, you okay? How we doing? Good? Bad?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Really, really good. Really good. Do you plan on helping out?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: I'm trying. He won't come out.

scene.description: [Cull Obsidian arrives at the park and throws his hammer at Bruce and Iron Man.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Hammer. [Pushes Bruce out of the way.]

scene.description: [Iron Man's energy beam deflects off Cull Obsidian's shield, slicing down trees. Bruce barely evades one.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Crawling out from under the branches. Desperate and confused] Come on, Hulk. What are you doing to me? [Starts slapping himself multiple times] Come out! Come out! Come out!

dialogue.speaker: Hulk
dialogue.line: [Half of Bruce's face becomes the Hulk.] Nooooooo! [Bruce falls back exhausted into his tree.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: What do you mean, "no"?!

scene.description: [Iron Man is knocked down by Obsidian, who is about to deliver a decisive blow, but the alien's hammer is easily caught by Spider-Man.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Hey, man. What's up, Mr. Stark?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Kid, where'd you come from?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Field trip to MoMA.

scene.description: [Cull Obsidian grabs Spider-Man and throws him away.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: What is this guy's problem, Mr. Stark?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: He's from space. He came here to steal a necklace from a wizard.

scene.description: [Wong and Doctor Strange fight Maw. Maw lifts several bricks from the ground and turns them into sharp points. He sends them towards Wong and Doctor Strange. The two make portals and boomerang them back towards Maw. Maw moves a car to protect himself, but one spike still hits his head, creating a cut. Angered, Maw uses a broken fire hydrant's water stream to knock Wong back several meters, rendering him unconscious.]

[Doctor Strange snaps a whip of magical energy to bind Maw's hands and yanks, but Maw flies forward with the pull and pins Doctor Strange upside-down against a building, using the bricks to trap the Sorcerer Supreme.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: Your powers are quaint. You must be popular with children.

scene.description: [Maw tries to grab the amulet holding the Time Stone but jerks back when it burns his hand.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: It's a simple spell but quite unbreakable.

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: [Vehemently] Then I'll take it off your corpse.

scene.description: [Maw pulls Doctor Strange away from the building and throws him to the ground. Doctor Strange starts the gestures to use the Eye of Agamotto, but utility cables first pin Doctor Strange's arms, interrupting the spell and closing the Eye, while another cable winds around his torso, then tightens around his throat.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: You'll find... removing a dead man's spell... troublesome.

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: You'll only wish you were dead. [Doctor Strange falls unconscious and to the ground; Maw raises a portion of street pavement to use as a carrier, but the Cloak of Levitation works its master loose of the cable spiral and flies Doctor Strange away.] NO!

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Still fighting Cull Obsidian, as Doctor Strange passes through the park.] Kid, that's the wizard. Get on it.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: On it!

scene.description: [Spider-Man chases Ebony Maw, floating speedily and upright on a small platform of burbling debris leaving a deep rut in the streets, who in turn chases the Cloak-driven Doctor Strange through Manhattan; Maw attacks him, throwing a Rocket Mortgage billboard at Spider-Man to be rid of him.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: [Untangles himself] Not cool!

scene.description: [Maw bends all the utility poles in the path of the fleeing Cloak, finally snagging the loyal garment and ripping it loose of its master. Spider-Man scoops up Doctor Strange before he hits the pavement, but before he can get away with the unconscious Doctor Strange, a cone of blue light starts pulling the mage inexorably upwards. Spider-Man grabs a light pole to anchor himself, but Maw uproots it, sending Doctor Strange, Cloak and teenager on their way to his ship.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Uhhh, Mr. Stark? I'm being beamed up!

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Hang on, kid. [Cull Obsidian's hammer doubles as a claw, pinning Iron Man to the ground and shorting his suit. As Obsidian jumps towards Iron Man, blades ready to end this fight, he is sent through a portal instead. The alien turns and leaps to return the same way, but Wong closes it rapidly -- only Obsidian's severed hand makes it back to the park. Bruce kicks the hand away with a noise of disgust.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Iron Man shakes himself free of the Dwarf's weapon, now powerless.] Wong, you're invited to my wedding. [Iron Man begins to fly towards the large ship] Give me a little juice, F.R.I.D.A.Y. [Iron Man's foot thrusters morph together into a single larger jet and increase his speed considerably.]

scene.description: [Ebony Maw walks towards the controls of the ship, Doctor Strange's unconscious body floating face-down behind him, and prepares to leave Earth's atmosphere.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Still in pursuit of the ship and his protege.] Unlock 17-A. [A pod launches from the upstate Avengers headquarters and curves up to the accelerating circular ship.] Pete, you gotta let go. I'm gonna catch you.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: But you said save the wizard! [Spider-Man, gasping from lack of oxygen, pulls off his mask] I can't breathe!

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: You're too high up. You're running out of air.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Yeah! That makes sense.

scene.description: [Peter passes out, free-falling, but not for long before the pod reaches him. It attaches itself to him, becoming the Iron Spider suit. Now being able to breathe, Spider-Man lands on a bottom part of the ship, standing up heroically.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Mr. Stark, it smells like a new car in here!

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Happy trails, kid. F.R.I.D.A.Y, send him home.

dialogue.speaker: F.R.I.D.A.Y.
dialogue.line: Yep.

scene.description: [A large parachute extends from the new suit, snatching Spider-Man free of the ship's hull and him spiraling back to Earth.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: OH, COME ON!

scene.description: [Iron Man latches onto the hull and cuts a hole to board the ship, looking for wherever Strange and Ebony Maw went.]

dialogue.speaker: F.R.I.D.A.Y.
dialogue.line: Boss, incoming call from Miss Potts.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: [Sounding heavily worried] Tony? Oh, my God. Are you all right? What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yeah, I'm fine. I just think we might have to push our 8:30 res.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Why?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [While looking at the ship around him] Just 'cause I'll... probably not make it back for a while.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Tell me you're not on that ship.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: God, no. Please tell me you're not on that ship.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Honey, I'm sorry. I'm sorry, I don't know what to say.

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Come back here, Tony. I swear to God….

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Pep….

dialogue.speaker: Pepper Potts
dialogue.line: Come back here right now! Come back!

dialogue.speaker: F.R.I.D.A.Y.
dialogue.line: Boss, we're losing her. I'm going, too….

scene.description: [Spider-Man is revealed to have managed to shoot a web to the outside of the ship, foiling his parachute, and clambers inside a slowly-closing chamber.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Oh my God! [Looks at the rapidly-receding planet behind him] I should have stayed on the bus....

scene.description: [Ebony Maw, hands engaged in the ship's steering mechanism, accelerates into hyperspace.]
[Meanwhile, back in New York]
[Bruce finds Tony's flip-phone in the debris on the street and picks it up thoughtfully. Wong opens up a portal back to the Sanctum.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Where you going?

dialogue.speaker: Wong
dialogue.line: The Time Stone's been taken. The Sanctum remains unguarded. What will you do?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Holding Rogers' cell phone] I'm gonna make a call.

scene.description: [Wong nods in understanding and closes the portal, not to be seen again for the rest of the movie. Banner holds Steve Rogers' cell phone and makes a call.]
[Screen title: SPACE]
[Camera pans around a brightly colored planet with ice rings to the Benatar. The Guardians of the Galaxy are travelling to investigate a distress call to the tune of "Rubberband Man".]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Chair-dancing to the song] Sing it, Drax!

scene.description: [Drax is snoring with his mouth open from his seat in front of Quill. Gamora lip-syncs with the song along with Quill.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: [Yawns] Why are we doing this again?

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: [Annoyed] It's a distress signal, Rocket. Someone could be dying.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: I get that, but why are we doing it?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: 'Cause we're nice. And maybe whoever it is will give us a little cheddar cheese [Quill rubs his thumb against his other fingers] for our help.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: [Waves her index finger at Quill] Which isn't the point.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Points back at Gamora] Which isn't the point... I mean… if he doesn't pony up….

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: We'll take his ship.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Exactly!

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: B-b-b-bingo!

scene.description: [Gamora looks up at Quill in concern. Quill returns her look and grimaces a "don't worry about it" expression at her.]

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: [Reading her console] We are arriving.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: All right, Guardians. Don't forget, this might be dangerous, so let's put on our mean faces. [Groot rolls his eyes as Mantis makes a snarl. Groot's handheld Terran-vintage video game beeps.] Groot, put that thing away. Now. I don't wanna tell you again. [Game continues beeping] Groot.

dialogue.speaker: Groot
dialogue.line: [In a mocking tone] I am Groot! (Translation: Shut up, bitch!)

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Whoa!

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Language!

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: You got some acorns on you, kid.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Ever since you got a little sap, you're a total d-hole. Keep it up, and I'm gonna SMASH THAT THING TO PIECES!

scene.description: [Groot rolls his eyes.]

[The Benatar decelerates, and Thanos' devastation suddenly covers the Guardians' field of view, revealing the distress signal to be the one from the Asgardian vessel at the beginning of the movie. Bodies are seen floating dead in space along with the pieces of the shredded ship.]

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: What happened?

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Looks like we're not getting paid.

scene.description: [With a thump, Thor's body is plastered to the hull of the ship.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: [Waving his hands] Wipers! Wipers! Get it off!

scene.description: [Thor’s eye opens; all gasp.]
[Cut to the Guardians settling the still-unconscious Thor onto an examination table.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: How the hell is this dude still alive?

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: [Sounding awed] He is not a dude. You're a dude. This... this is a man. A handsome, muscular man.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [A little dented] I'm muscular.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Who are you kidding, Quill? You're one sandwich away from fat.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Yeah, right.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: It's true. You have gained a little weight…. [Drax motions to his chin and belly.]

scene.description: [Gamora leaves Quill's side at Thor's right, and circles around the foot of the table.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: What? Gamora, do you think I'm…

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: He is anxious. Angry. He feels tremendous loss and guilt.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: It's like a pirate had a baby with an angel.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Wow. This is a real wake-up call for me. Okay. I'm gonna get a Bow-flex. I'm gonna commit. I'm gonna get some dumbbells.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: You know you can't eat dumbbells, right?

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: [Reaches Drax's side and picks up Thor's left arm, stroking his triceps] It's like his muscles are made of Cotati metal fibers.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Snidely to Gamora] Stop massaging his muscles. [Gamora, annoyed, drops the arm with a thump; quietly to Mantis] Wake him up.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: [Places hand on Thor's forehead] Wake.

scene.description: [Thor awakens, sitting up violently and throwing himself off the table to stumble a few steps away, then turning to see his hosts all pointing their weapons of choice at him; Groot is still playing his game.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Who the hell are you guys?

scene.description: [Cut to later as the Guardians stand around Thor eating soup.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: The entire time I knew Thanos, he only ever had one goal: To bring balance to the Universe by wiping out half of all life. He used to kill people planet by planet, massacre by massacre....

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: Including my own.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: If he gets all six Infinity Stones, he can do it with the snap of his fingers, like this. [She snaps her fingers.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: You seem to know a great deal about Thanos.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: Gamora... is the daughter of Thanos.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Your father killed my brother. [Thor stands and strides towards Gamora aggressively.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Oh, boy. Stepfather. Technically, she hates him as much as you do. [Thor softens a bit.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Families can be tough. [He claps a hand on Gamora's shoulder] Before my father died, he told me I had a half-sister... that he imprisoned in Hel. Then she returned home, and stabbed me in the eye, so... I had to kill her. It's life, isn't it, I guess. Goes round and round and... I feel your pain.

scene.description: [Peter glares at Thor's hand on Gamora's shoulder, on the verge of full snarl, and moves around her to push between her and Thor.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: And I feel your pain, as well. I mean it's not a competition, but I've been through a lot. My father killed my mother, then I had to kill my father. And that was hard. Probably even harder than having to kill a sister. Plus, I, came out of it with both of my eyes--

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Not paying attention as he stares at his soup spoon] I need a hammer, not a spoon…. (He attempts to fiddle with machinery) How do I open this thing? Is there some sort of a four-digit code maybe… maybe a birth date or something….

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Taking your pod.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Clears his throat then deepens his voice] No, you're not! [Mimics Thor’s accent] You'll not, be taking our pod today, sir.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Quill. Are you making your voice deeper?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: No.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: You are. You're imitating the god-man. It's weird.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: No I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: [Gasp] He just did it again!

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: This is my voice!

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Steps closer to Quill] Are you mocking me?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Are you mocking me?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Stop it. You did it again.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: He's trying to copy me.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Would you stop doing that? He's doing it first.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Enough! We need to stop Thanos. Which means we need to find out where he's going next.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Knowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: He must be going somewhere.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Voice now normal] No. Knowhere? It's a place. We've been there. It sucks. Excuse me, that's our food. [To Thor as he rummages through their food stores.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Not anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Thor… why would he go to Knowhere?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Because for years, the Reality Stone has been safely stored, there with a man we call the Collector.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: If it's with the Collector, then it's not safe. Only an idiot would give that man a stone.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Or a genius.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: [To Thor] How do you know he's not going for one of the other Stones?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: There's six stones out there. [Finishes rummaging and steps in front of Gamora] Thanos already has the Power Stone because he stole it last week, when he decimated Xandar. He stole the Space Stone from me when he destroyed my ship and slaughtered half my people. The Time and Mind Stones are safe on Earth. They're with the Avengers.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: The 'Avengers'?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [By way of explanation.] Earth's Mightiest Heroes.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: Like Kevin Bacon?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Pause] He may be on the team. I don't know. Haven't been there in a while. As for the Soul Stone, well, no one's ever seen that. No one even knows where it is. Therefore, Thanos can't get it. Therefore, he's going to Knowhere. Hence, he'll be getting the Reality Stone. You're welcome.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Then we have to go to Knowhere now.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Wrong! Where we have to go, is Nivadellir.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: That's a made up word.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: All words are made up.

scene.description: [It's official: mind blown.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Hold up, Nidavellir is real? [Climbing on to the table] Seriously? I mean, that place is a legend. [Increasingly gleeful] They make the most powerful, horrific weapons to ever torment the Universe. I would very much like to go there, please.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: The rabbit is correct, and clearly the smartest among you.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Rabbit?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Only Eitri the dwarf king can make me the weapon I need. [To Rocket] I assume you're the captain, sir?

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: You're very perceptive.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: You seem like a noble leader. Will you join me on my quest to Nidavellir?

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Lemme just ask the captain. Oh, wait a second, it's me! Yeah, I'll go.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Wonderful.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Except for that I'm the captain.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Quiet!

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: That's my backpack.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Go sit down.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [To Thor] Look, this is my ship. And I'm not goin' to… [gropes for "Nidavellir"] Wait, what kind of weapon are we talking about here?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: The Thanos killing kind.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Don't you think that we should all have a weapon like that?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: No. You simply lack the strength to wield them. Your bodies will crumble as your minds collapse into the madness.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Is it weird that I wanna do it even more now?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: A little bit. Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: If we don't go to Knowhere and Thanos retrieves another stone, he'll be too powerful to stop.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: He already is.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: I got it figured out. We got two ships, and a large assortment of morons. So me and Groot will go with the pirate-angel here, and the morons will go to Knowhere to try and stop Thanos. Cool? Cool.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: So cool. [Smiles a big grin.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [To Rocket] For the record… I know that you're only going with him because it's where Thanos isn't.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: You know, you shouldn't talk that way to your captain, Quill. [As he enters the pod] Come on, Groot. Put that game down, you'll rot your brain.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: I bid you farewell and good luck, morons. Bye.

scene.description: [The Guardians nod or wave farewell as Thor, Rocket and Groot depart. Cut to Scotland, where Vision and Wanda Maximoff are sharing a room. Wanda is in bed while Vision, in a human glamour, watches out a window.]
[High-pitched trilling]

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: [Gasps and holds his hand to the Mind Stone in pain.]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: Vis? Is it the stone again?

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: It's as if it's speaking to me.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: What does it say?

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: I don't... I don't know. But something...

scene.description: [The stone trills again and Vision flinches. Wanda takes his face in her hands. Vision turns his head so he can kiss her left palm, then presses Wanda's hand to the Mind Stone.]

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: Tell me what you feel.

scene.description: [Wanda gestures, her hand emanating her red swirling energy. She seems confused.]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: I just feel you.

scene.description: [They kiss. Cut to later, where the two are going on a stroll.]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: So there's a 10 AM to Glasgow to give us more time together before you went back.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: What if I miss that train?

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: There is an 11.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: What if I missed all the trains? What if this time, I didn't go back?

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: You gave Stark your word.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: I'd rather give it to you.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: There are people who are expecting me too, you know. We both made promises.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: Not to each other. [He puts his hands on her shoulders] Wanda… for two years, we've stolen these moments, trying to see if this could work. And... I don't know. [Stammers] You know what, I'm just gonna speak for myself -- I, I... I think...

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: It works.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: It works.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: Then stay. Stay with me.

scene.description: [Wanda looks down, but then her eyes and attention drift to her left.]

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: [Suddenly very uncertain] Or not. If I'm overstepping…

scene.description: [Wanda steps over to a better view of the TV in the kebab shop at which they had stopped, drawing Vision with her. It shows coverage of the invasion of New York, the alien antagonists, and the disappearance of Tony Stark.]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: [Fearful] What are they?

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: What the stone was warning me about. [He kisses her hand] I have to go.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: No, Vision. Vision, if that's true… then maybe going isn't the best idea.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: Wanda, I… [Corvus Glaive appears suddenly behind Vision, stabbing him through the back. Vision screams, loses his glamour to return to his green, red and gold appearance, and is thrown down into the street.]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: Vision! [She circles her hands, gathering up energy for a counterattack when Proxima Midnight blasts her from behind, knocking the Scarlet Witch across the street and through a bistro's window.]

scene.description: [Corvus Glaive pins Vision down and digs the point of his high-tech glaive into Vision's forehead in an attempt to extract the Mind Stone.]

[The Scarlet Witch commits her own surprise attack, blasts both of the aliens away, then lifts Vision and herself into a nearby courtyard, from where the Scarlet Witch drags him to rest in a concealed alleyway.]

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: The blade. It stopped me from phasing.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: Is that even possible?

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: It isn't supposed to be. [His voice distorts electronically] My systems are failing. [The Scarlet Witch gestures over his gaping wound, using her magic to knit him back together. Vision continues in a gasping, wry tone] I'm beginning to think... we should have stayed in bed.

scene.description: [Corvus Glaive suddenly arrives, knocking the Scarlet aside and grabbing Vision into the air,]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: Vis!

scene.description: [Corvus flies away with Vision, slamming him against several walls. Meanwhile, Proxima engages the Scarlet Witch with her staff weapon and they too begin to fight.]

dialogue.speaker: Corvus Glaive
dialogue.line: [To Vision] Give up the Stone, and she lives.

scene.description: [Vision flies with Corvus to the roof of what appears to be a church, ricocheting off the stone church tower and onto the metal-clad roof.]

[Simultaneously, Proxima and the Scarlet Witch fight below, staff weapon versus magic energy hands until Proxima uses the blaster effect of her weapon to knock the Scarlet Witch meters away, stunning her as Proxima leaps down, brandishing her weapon within bare inches of the Scarlet Witch's face, only held back by the Scarlet Witch's powers]

[Furiously, Vision pummels Corvus, then throws him across the roof, firing a beam from the Mind Stone. Corvus uses his glaive to deflect the beam, splitting it into several beams, cutting up Edinburgh's ancient stone like butter, until one branch finally reflects back at Vision, slamming him into the wall behind him.]

[Down below, the Scarlet Witch has blocked Proxima's staff once again when she hears an agonized cry from Vision. Desperation strengthens her to throw Proxima through the burning lorry sliced in half by the split Stone beam, stunning the alien. The Scarlet Witch then flies up to the roof where Glaive has pinned Vision and is again attempting to remove the Mind Stone.]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: Hands off.

scene.description: [The Scarlet Witch casts a bolt of magic which throws Corvus back through the wall and down a shaft, then flies the two of them away again. Proxima, who has recovered, shoots a bolt from her weapon, causing them to fall from the air and down through the roof of Edinburgh Waverley Train Station. Wanda crawls over to Vision, who cannot muster the strength to stand.]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: [Hushed voice, pleading.] Come on. Come on. Come on, you gotta get up. You gotta get up. Come on. Hey. Hey. We have to go.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: Please. Please leave.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: You asked me to stay.... I'm staying.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: Please.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: Get up.

scene.description: [Behind them, Proxima and Corvus crash through the roof and advance on them, brandishing their weapons. the Scarlet Witch moves protectively in front of Vision, building power in her hands.]

[An express train passes behind Wanda, and Proxima cocks her head as if aware of another's presence. Confused, the Scarlet Witch also turns and looks over her left shoulder. As the last train car passes, we see a silhouette on the far side of the platform. Proxima throws her weapon at the shadowy figure, but it is deftly caught just before the figure steps from the shadows.]

[As the Avengers theme kicks in, we now recognize a bearded and furious Steve Rogers (Captain America) as he steps into the light. Vision and the Scarlet Witch look hopeful and relieved. While all parties are distracted, Sam Wilson (Falcon) swoops in and kicks Proxima across the platform and through the closed cafe's security gate and furniture. Swooping around, he fires on Corvus.]

[At the same time, Captain America throws Proxima's weapon to Natasha Romanoff (Black Widow) who engages Corvus, ducking under his swing, stabbing him in the gut and executing a flying kick to knock him backwards.]

[Proxima, who has rushed back to the fight, summons her weapon back to her hand and attacks Black Widow. Captain America leaps forward, rolls, scoops up Corvus's dropped glaive and holds her off. Black Widow joins in with her own escrima sticks. While the three are fighting, Falcon returns and again kicks Proxima backwards; she scuttles over to the prone Corvus. Falcon draws both of his Steyr SPP submachine pistols on the couple.]

dialogue.speaker: Proxima Midnight
dialogue.line: [To Glaive] Get up.

dialogue.speaker: Corvus Glaive
dialogue.line: I can't.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: [Coolly] We don't wanna kill you. But we will.

dialogue.speaker: Proxima Midnight
dialogue.line: You'll never get the chance again.

scene.description: [Proxima Midnight and Corvus Glaive depart as they are beamed up. The glaive is snatched from Captain America's hand as well.]

dialogue.speaker: Sam Wilson
dialogue.line: [To Vision] Can you stand?

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: [Electricity shimmers over his surface, and his voice distorts] Thank you, Captain.

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: [Nods] Let's get you on the jet.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: [Closing the doors to the Quinjet, while addressing Wanda] I thought we had a deal. Stay close, check in. Don't take any chances.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: I'm sorry. We just wanted time.

dialogue.speaker: Sam Wilson
dialogue.line: Where to, Cap?

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: Home.

scene.description: [Cut to the past, at Gamora's home planet Zen-Whoberi during Thanos' massacre. Gamora and her mother are hiding; the sounds of guns and screaming are outside.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora's Mother
dialogue.line: [To Young Gamora] Shh. We'll be safe. We'll be safe.

scene.description: [An explosion goes off close by and Gamora screeches by reflex, revealing their hiding spot.]

dialogue.speaker: Child of Thanos
dialogue.line: [Untranslated inquiry.]

scene.description: [The door is smashed open and both Zehobereians scream.]

[Outside, it is utter chaos. Leviathans, Chitauri chariots and ring-ships fly overhead; explosions and energy bolts from numerous sources criss-cross the panicked population, felling them randomly; smoke arises from countless fires.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: Zehobereians…

dialogue.speaker: Young Gamora
dialogue.line: [Being dragged by one arm through the crowds] Mother! Where's my mother?!

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: Zen-Whoberis... Choose a side, or die.

dialogue.speaker: Young Gamora
dialogue.line: Mother! [She punches at the arm of the one dragging her who surprisingly drops her arm and leaves.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: One side is a revelation. The other, an honor known only to a few.

scene.description: [Gamora turns and finds herself facing Thanos in his full Titan armor.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: What's wrong, little one?

dialogue.speaker: Young Gamora
dialogue.line: My mother. Where is my mother?

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Kneels down to Gamora] What's your name?

dialogue.speaker: Young Gamora
dialogue.line: Gamora.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: You're quite the fighter, Gamora. Come. Let me help you. [Thanos offers his hand; she wraps her little fingers around one massive finger, and he leads her to a pavilion, where he crouches to her eye level again and produces a small -- for him -- red-jeweled handle. Pressing the switch, razor-sharp blades pop out both ends.] Look. Pretty, isn't it? Perfectly balanced. As all things should be. Too much to one side, or the other… [He balances it on one finger, overbalances it purposefully and catches it.] Here. You try.

scene.description: [Thanos hands Gamora the dagger -- the handle is two child-palms' widths in length. She tries balancing it on her index finger.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: Now go in peace, and meet your Maker.

scene.description: [One half of the crowd is shot down. The survivors scream in horror, and Gamora tries to turn but Thanos prevents her from seeing the massacre.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Concentrate. There! You've got it.

scene.description: [Cut to the present, aboard the GUARDIANS’ ship. Gamora is brooding, activates the spring-action blades on the same dagger.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Gamora. Do you know if these grenades are the "blow off your junk" kind or the gas kind? 'Cause I was thinking I might hang a couple on my belt right here. But I don't want to--

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: I need to ask a favor.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Yeah, sure.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: One way or another, the path that we're on leads to Thanos.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Which is what the grenades are for. [Gamora silences him with a look.] I'm sorry. What's the favor?

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: If things go wrong… If Thanos gets me… I want you to promise me… you'll kill me.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [A beat. Confusion.] What?

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: I know something he doesn't. If he finds out… the entire Universe could be at risk.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: What do you know?

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: If I tell you, you'd know, too.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: If it's so important, shouldn't I?

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Only if you wanna die.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Why does somebody always have to die in this scenario?

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Just… trust me. And possibly, kill me.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: I mean, I'd like to. I really would… [Gamora silences him by covering his mouth with her hand.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Swear to me. Swear to me on your mother.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [A beat. One that rests with him significantly.] Okay.

scene.description: [The two kiss, until an odd crunching sound startles them. Drax is standing in the corner.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Dude. How long have you been standing there?

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: An hour.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: An hour? Are you serious?

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: I've mastered the ability of standing so incredibly still... that I become invisible to the eye... watch.

scene.description: [Drax stands motionless, then very slowly raises his hand towards his mouth]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: You're eating a zarg-nut.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: But my movement... was so slow... that it's imperceptible.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Mmm, no. [Quill and Gamora shake their heads.]

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: I'm sure I'm invisible.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: Hi, Drax.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: [Knowing when he is beat] Damn it.

scene.description: [The Benatar flies towards a massive skull and flies through one eye-hole into a vast interior cavern. Screen title: KNOWHERE.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: This place looks deserted.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: I'm reading movement from the third quadrant.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Yep. I'm picking that up, too. Let's put it down right here.

scene.description: [The four Guardians disembark and sneak into the Collector’s collection room, which is in ruins. Thanos is threatening the Collector while the Guardians hide behind rubble.]

dialogue.speaker: Collector
dialogue.line: I don't have it.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Everyone in the Galaxy knows you'd sell your own brother if you thought it would add the slightest trinket to your pathetic collection.

scene.description: [Quill stops, and holds up a fist meaning 'halt' in the silent language of soldiers. Everybody walks quietly past him.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I know you have the Reality Stone, Tivan. Giving it to me will spare you a great deal of suffering. [Thanos places a heavy boot on the middle of the Collector's chest and presses.]

dialogue.speaker: Collector
dialogue.line: [Strained] I told you. I sold it. Why would I lie?

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I imagine it's like breathing for you.

dialogue.speaker: Collector
dialogue.line: Like suicide.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: So you do understand. Not even you would surrender something so precious.

dialogue.speaker: Collector
dialogue.line: I didn't know what it was.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Then you're more of a fool than I took you for. Last chance, charlatan. Where's the Stone?

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: Today...

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Grasping the danger] Drax. Drax.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: ...He pays for the deaths of my wife and daughter.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Drax, waaaaait! [Drax draws his long dagger from his leg scabbard.] Not yet, not yet, not yet. [Drax gives him a look and heads towards Thanos. Quill hurries as quietly as possible to catch up.] Drax, Drax, Drax. He doesn't have the Stone yet. We get it, and then we can stop him. We have to get the Stone first. Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: No. No. For Ovette. For Camaria.

scene.description: [Quill starts to struggle with Drax when Mantis puts her hand on the back of Drax's head.]

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: Sleeeep. [Drax is knocked out, his falling body causing a loud crash. Everybody ducks.]

scene.description: [Thanos looks towards the sound, then picks up the Collector and throws him into a collecting case before walking towards the disturbance.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Okay. Gamora, Mantis, you go right. I'm... [Gamora moves towards Thanos] The other right!

scene.description: [Gamora leaps on Thanos from a stack of boxes, swinging her sword at him. He snaps the sword-blade in half, and Gamora stabs him in the throat with the stub, his lower jaw sagging and himself letting out a hoarse groan, then he is stabbed in the chest with the red-jeweled dagger.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Why? [He falls down] Why you? Daughter… [He holds his hand out to her, blood pooling out from his neck wound, before collapsing completely. Gamora breaks down, sobbing.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Surprised] That was quick.

dialogue.speaker: Collector
dialogue.line: Magnificent! Magnificent! Magnificent!

scene.description: [Suddenly, Thanos' disembodied voice fills the room.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Is it sadness I sense in you, daughter? In my heart, I knew you still cared. But one ever knows for sure. Reality is often disappointing.

scene.description: [The scene disappears -- everything in the room is destroyed and/or on fire, the Collector waving bye-bye as he and his case vanish.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: That is, it was. Now… reality can be whatever I want.

scene.description: [Thanos is quite alive and undamaged. He has the red Reality Stone seated in the Infinity Gauntlet.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: [Her face still wet, but no longer crying] You knew I'd come.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I counted on it. There's something we need to discuss, little one.

scene.description: [Gamora hesitates for a beat, then reaches for her broken sword. Thanos grabs her by the back of the neck and swings her around in front of him.]

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: Thanos!

scene.description: [With a pulse of the Reality Stone, both Drax and Mantis are 'disassembled' -- Drax is turned into a stack of tumbling cubes, and Mantis becomes a ribbon version of herself.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Moving in, his blaster pointed right at Thanos] Let her go, Grimace!

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Peter…

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [To Gamora] I told you to go right.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Now? Really?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: You let her go!

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Ah, the boyfriend.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: I like to think of myself more as a Titan-killing long-term booty call. Let her go.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Peter…

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Or I'm gonna blow that nut sack of a chin right off your face!

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Not him.

scene.description: [Quill hesitates. He does not shoot anyone.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: You promised! You promised.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Oh, daughter. You expect too much from him. [to Quill] She's asked, hasn't she? Do it. [There is a very tense and unpleasant pause. Thanos rolls his head and shoves Gamora towards Quill’s gun, egging him on.] DO IT!!

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Tearing up] I told you to go right.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: I love you, more than anything.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: I love you, too.

scene.description: [Quill screws up his eyes and pulls the trigger -- but a stream of bubbles comes out. Thanos was playing him.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Genuinely sincere] I like you.

scene.description: [Thanos teleports Gamora and himself away as a stunned Quill picks up Gamora's sword, and his friends painfully re-assemble themselves, the Reality Stone's effects now subsiding in its absence.]

(Back on Earth, the Quinjet arrives at the upstate New York Avengers HQ while Col. James "Rhodey" Rhodes deals with the red tape in the holographic person of Secretary of State Thaddeus Ross (Lt. Gen., USA Ret.).)

dialogue.speaker: Secretary Ross
dialogue.line: Still no word from Vision?

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: Satellites lost him somewhere over Edinburgh.

dialogue.speaker: Secretary Ross
dialogue.line: On a stolen Quinjet with four of the world's most wanted criminals.

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: You know they're only criminals because you've chosen to call them that, right, sir?

dialogue.speaker: Secretary Ross
dialogue.line: My God, Rhodes, your talent for horseshit rivals my own.

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: If it weren't for those Accords, Vision would've been right here.

dialogue.speaker: Secretary Ross
dialogue.line: I remember your signature on those papers, Colonel.

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: [Sounding a little bitter] That's right. And I'm pretty sure I've paid for that. [We get a good look at his leg braces]

dialogue.speaker: Secretary Ross
dialogue.line: You have second thoughts?

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: Not anymore.

scene.description: [The fugitive Avengers enter the room, Vision supported by Sam.]

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: Mr. Secretary.

dialogue.speaker: Secretary Ross
dialogue.line: You got some nerve. I'll give you that.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: You could use some of that right now.

dialogue.speaker: Secretary Ross
dialogue.line: The world's on fire. And you think, all is forgiven?

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: I'm not looking for forgiveness. And I'm way past asking for permission. Earth just lost her best defender. So we're here to fight. [Steve takes a step forward, looking right at Ross] And if you wanna stand in our way... we'll fight you, too.

dialogue.speaker: Secretary Ross
dialogue.line: [To Rhodes] Arrest them.

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: All over it. [Swipes off hologram; the computer beeps twice] That's a court-martial. It's great to see you, Cap.

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: [Hugging Rhodes] You too, Rhodey. [Natasha gets her own embrace.]

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: Well. You guys really look like crap. Must've been a rough couple of years.

dialogue.speaker: Sam Wilson
dialogue.line: Yeah, well, the hotels weren't exactly five star.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Uh, I think you look great. [Rhodes and Natasha long round to see Bruce walking in from the opposite end of the room.] Uh... heh... Yeah. I'm back.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: Hi, Bruce.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Nat.

dialogue.speaker: Sam Wilson
dialogue.line: [Whispering] This is awkward.

scene.description: [Cut to a shot of Natasha, Bruce, Steve, Rhodey, Wanda, and Vision in another room.]

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: So we gotta assume they're coming back, right?

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: And they can clearly find us.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: We need all hands on deck. Where's Clint?

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: After the whole Accords situation, he and Scott took a deal. It was too tough on their families, they're on house arrest.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Who's Scott?

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: Ant-Man.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: There's an Ant-Man and a Spider-Man? Okay, look… Thanos has the biggest army in the universe. And he is not gonna stop until he... he gets... Vision's Stone.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: Well then, we have to protect it.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: No, we have to destroy it. I've been giving a good deal of thought to this entity in my head, about its nature. But also, its composition. I think if it were exposed to a sufficiently powerful energy source, something, very similar to its own signature, perhaps… its molecular integrity could fail. [Vision addresses Wanda as he nears her.]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: And you, with it. We're not having this conversation.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: Eliminating the stone is the only way to be certain that Thanos can't get it.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: That's too high a price.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: [Takes her face gently in both hands] Only you have the power to pay it. [Wanda walks away, distressed] Thanos threatens half the Universe. One life cannot stand in the way of defeating him.

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: [Eyes diverted down] But it should. [Looks up at Vision] We don't trade lives, Vision.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: [Walking toward Steve] Captain, 70 years ago, you laid down your life to save how many millions of people. Tell me, why is this any different?

scene.description: [Steve takes a breath, but before he has a chance to answer, Bruce speaks.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Because you might have a choice. Your mind is made up of a complex construct of overlays. J.A.R.V.I.S., Ultron, Tony, me, the Stone. All of them mixed together. All of them learning from one another.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: You're saying Vision isn't just the stone?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: I'm saying that if we take out the stone, there's still a whole lot of Vision left. Perhaps the best parts.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: Can we do that?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Not me. Not here.

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: You better find someone, and somewhere fast. Ross isn't exactly just gonna let you guys have your old rooms back.

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: I know somewhere.

scene.description: [Cut to rural Wakanda, as King T'Challa and Okoye walk together, accompanied by two Kingsguard. Screen title: WAKANDA.]

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: You'll have the Kingsguard, and the Dora Milaje have been alerted.

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: And the Border Tribe?

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: Those that are left.

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: Send word to the Jabari as well. M'Baku likes a good fight.

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: And what of this one?

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: This one may be tired of war. [James "Bucky" Buchanan Barnes is seen at a small distance throwing a bag from a pile on the ground onto a partly-filled cart, while two village children watch] But the White Wolf has rested long enough.

scene.description: [The party reaches Bucky. A Kingsguards-man sets an elaborate and high-tech-looking equipment case down on the cart, opens the lid, and steps back. As the Winter Soldier approaches, he sees a new Vibranium arm in the case.]

dialogue.speaker: Bucky Barnes
dialogue.line: [With resignation] Where's the fight?

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: On its way.

scene.description: [Cut to Ebony Maw interrogating Dr. Strange. Dr. Strange is floating horizontally, face down, and is surrounded by dozens of glassy needles, each about two feet long.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: In all the time I've served Thanos, I've never failed him. If I were to reach our rendezvous on Titan with the Time Stone still attached to your vaguely irritating person, there would be... judgement. [The needles start to contact Dr. Strange's face, causing an obviously painful whitish subcutaneous glow at each touch] Give me... the stone.

scene.description: [Cut to Tony who is watching, hidden, from above. The Cloak of Levitation taps Stark on the arm. He raises his hand to it, ready to shoot, but he sees what it is and stands down.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Wow you're a seriously loyal piece of outerwear, aren't you?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Yeah, uh, speaking of loyalty....

scene.description: [Tony and the Cloak turn to face Peter, dropping down from above]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: What the--

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: I know what you're gonna say.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: You should not be here.

scene.description: [The Cloak moves to "stand" at Tony's side]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: I was gonna go home--

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: I don't wanna hear it.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: But it was such a long way down and I just thought about you on the way...

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: And now I gotta hear it.

scene.description: [The Cloak shakes its collar in sympathy and shrugs]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: ...And I kinda stuck to the side of the ship. And this suit is ridiculously intuitive, by the way. So if anything, it's kinda your fault that I'm here.

scene.description: [The Cloak looks shocked.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Seriously] What did you just say?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: I take that back. And now I'm here in space.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
