dialogue.line: Yeah. [Tony crosses to stand right in front of Peter] Right where I don't want you to be. This isn't Coney Island. This isn't a field trip. It's a one-way ticket. You hear me? Don't pretend like you thought this through. You could not have possibly thought this through.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: No. I did think this through.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: You could not have possibly thought this through.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: It's just .. you can't be a friendly neighborhood Spider-Man if there's no neighborhood. [He waits for Tony's reaction] Okay. That didn't really make any sense, but you know what I'm trying to say.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Breaths shakily] Come on. We got a situation. [He leads Peter over to a viewpoint on the torture below. Peter crouches to study the situation, the Cloak leaning over his shoulder.] See him down there? He's in trouble. What's your plan? Go.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Um. Okay, okay... uh... [Peter and the Cloak pop back upright] Okay. Did you ever see this really old movie, Aliens?

scene.description: [The Cloak lifts its collar in surprise.]
[Cut back to Ebony Maw interrogating Dr. Strange, who groans loudly.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: Painful aren't they? They were originally designed for microsurgery. And any one of them...

scene.description: [At the "thump" behind him, Maw turns to see Iron Man standing there, hand repulsors ready to fire.]

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: ...Could end your friend's life in an instant.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: I gotta tell you, he's not really my friend. Saving his life is more a professional courtesy.

dialogue.speaker: Ebony Maw
dialogue.line: [Walks slowly towards Iron Man, beckoning very large, very solid metal objects to float behind him] You've saved nothing. Your powers are inconsequential compared to mine.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yeah, but the kid's seen more movies.

scene.description: [Iron Man fires a rocket from his shoulder which pierces the side of the ship to Maw's right and begins to suck everything out with depressurization, especially Maw and his large objects. Dr. Strange is pulled loose of his pinnings, loses the needles, but also heads for the hole, helpless to resist. The Cape wraps around his arm and an anchor point, but Dr. Strange's arm slips loose and he keeps going. Spider-Man shoots a web strand at Dr. Strange with one hand and holds onto a piece of the ship with the other. It breaks, sending them both towards space when his Iron-Spider suit's metal arms brace him to keep him from being sucked out. Fortunately, Dr. Strange is still surrounded by the ship's atmosphere making haste to leave.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Yes! Wait what are those?!

scene.description: [Spider-Man crouches with his new spider-legs, and makes a mighty leap to pulls them both back inside. Iron Man quickly sprays nanites onto the hole to plug it up. Dr. Strange safely, if emphatically, hits the floor. Ebony Maw is seen floating in space, quite dead, ice from the escaped atmosphere frosting over his grimace. Spider-Man lands on his new legs, retracts them, and finds the Cape "standing" next to him.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Hey, we haven't officially met. [He offers the Cape his hand to shake. It ignores his offer and continues to Dr. Strange.] Cool.

scene.description: [Iron Man walks past Dr. Strange, shaking his head and with his armor retreating into its containment as Dr. Strange gets to his feet and becomes en-Cloaked.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: We've gotta turn this ship around.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yeah. Now he wants to run. Great plan.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: No, I want to protect the stone.

scene.description: [Tony walks towards the expansive front view-port, showing a hyper speed/warp effect.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Irritably] And I want you to thank me now. Go ahead, I'm listening.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: For what? Nearly blasting me into space?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Who just saved your magical ass? Me.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: I seriously don't know how you fit your head into that helmet.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Admit it. You should have ducked out when I told you to. I tried to bench you. You refused.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Unlike everyone else in your life, I don't work for you.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: And due to that fact, we're now in a flying doughnut billions of miles away from Earth with no backup.

scene.description: [Seriously, these two's egos are a recipe for disaster.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: [Raises his hand] I'm backup.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: No. You're a stowaway. [Waggles a finger between himself and Dr. Strange] The adults are talking.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: I'm sorry, I'm confused as to the relationship here. Wh-- what is he, your ward?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: No. I'm Peter, by the way.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Dr. Strange.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Oh, we're using our made-up names. Um... I'm Spider-Man, then.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: This ship is self-correcting its course. Thing's on autopilot.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Walks closer to Tony] Can we control it? Fly us home? [Tony is lost in bad memories and does not respond right away.] Stark?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Can you get us home?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yeah I heard you. I'm thinking... I'm not so sure we should.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Under no circumstance can we bring the Time Stone to Thanos. I don't think you quite understand what's at stake here.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Stalks over to Strange] No. It's you who doesn't understand, that Thanos has been inside my head for six years since he sent an army to New York and now he's back! And I don't know what to do. So I'm not so sure if it's a better plan to fight him on our turf or his but you saw what they did, what they can do. At least on his turf, he's not expecting it. So I say we take the fight to him. Doctor. Do you concur?

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Pauses] Alright, Stark. We go to him. But you have to understand... if it comes to saving you or the kid or the Time Stone... I will not hesitate to let either of you die. I can't, because the fate of the universe depends on it.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Nice. Good. Moral compass. We're straight. [Stepping over to Peter, he formally taps each of Peter's shoulders with the edge of his hand, dubbing him as is done at a knighting.] Alright, kid. You're an Avenger now. [He doesn't look at him as he says those words, knowing well what he is signing him up for.]

scene.description: [Peter looks at Tony in disbelief, and then cycles through delight, satisfaction, pride and determination, and braces himself for what's to come.]

[Cut to Thanos' mother-ship, Sanctuary II, which dwarfs the massive ring-ships the Black Order have been using. Gamora sits near the throne deep inside the ship. Thanos walks up, bringing a cup of food and holds it out to her.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I thought you might be hungry.

scene.description: [Gamora takes it, then hurls it across the room where it bangs against Thanos' throne with a loud clack.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: I always hated that chair.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: So I've been told. Even so. I'd hoped you'd sit on it one day.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: I hated this room. This ship. I hated my life.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: You told me that too. [Thanos mounts two of the four steps to his throne, turns, and sits on the second from the top.] Every day. For almost twenty years.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: I was a child when you took me.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I saved you.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: No. No. We were happy on my home planet.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Going to bed hungry, scrounging for scraps. Your planet was on the brink of collapse. I'm the one who stopped that. Do you know what's happened since then? The children born have known nothing but full bellies and clear skies. It's a paradise.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Because you murdered half the planet.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: A small price to pay for salvation.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: You're insane.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Little one, it's a simple calculus. This universe is finite, its resources finite. If life is left unchecked, life will cease to exist. It needs correction.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: You don't know that!

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Scowls as his egotistical narcissism prevents him from fully listening to her] I'm the only one who knows that. At least, I'm the only one with the will to act on it. [He stands again and walks back to Gamora] For a time... you had that same will... as you fought by my side. Daughter.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: I'm not your daughter. Everything I hate about myself you taught me.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: And in doing so, made you the fiercest woman in the galaxy. That's why I trusted you to find the Soul Stone.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: I'm sorry I disappointed you.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I am disappointed. But not because you didn't find it. [Leans down to put their heads at a level, whispering fiercely] But because you did. [Looks at her] And you lied.

scene.description: [Thanos and Gamora stand outside a large solid door that slides open vertically as they approach, then pause as a set of inner doors made of interlacing metal slide away. Inside, we see Nebula face-on, suspended horizontally in the air in the middle of the room, her breath shuddering in pain.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Nebula.

scene.description: [Gamora hurries to to Nebula's left side, and we now see that she has been partially disassembled, her components stretched apart -- a cybernetic version of the medieval torture rack. Hannibal Lecter level of brutality.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Don't do this.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Some time ago, your sister snuck aboard this ship to kill me.

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Please don't do this.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: And very nearly succeeded. So I brought her here. To talk.

scene.description: [Thanos curls his gauntleted fist, activating both the Power and Space Stones, scowling -- causing Nebula's already extended pieces to stretch further outward. She begins to scream.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Stop. Stop it. [She puts her hands on the gauntlet, pulling it down] I swear to you on my life. I never found the Soul Stone.

scene.description: [Thanos signals a nearby servant who taps on a control pad. We hear Nebula's voice say, "Accessing memory files" and a sort of hologram of Gamora's face shudders to life.]

dialogue.speaker: Memory Nebula
dialogue.line: You know what he's about to do. He's finally ready, and he's going for the stones. All of them.

dialogue.speaker: Memory Gamora
dialogue.line: He can never get them all.

dialogue.speaker: Memory Nebula
dialogue.line: He will!

dialogue.speaker: Memory Gamora
dialogue.line: He can't, Nebula. Because I found the map to the Soul Stone and I burnt it to ash. I burnt it.

scene.description: [The memory ends.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [To Gamora, walking around behind her] You're strong. Me. You're generous. Me. But I never taught you to lie. That's why you're so bad at it. [His voice drips with disgust] Where is the Soul Stone? [He raises his gauntlet next to Gamora's face. Nebula shakes her head, expression terrified, to encourage her sister's silence but when Gamora does not answer, Thanos clenches the gauntlet again, brow furrowed at his adopted daughter as the Power and Space Stones are reactivated. Gamora grimaces in shared pain at her sister's screams, growing louder as Thanos increases the pressure.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Vormir! [Thanos unclenches his hand, and Nebula gasps in air as her parts snap back almost into place. Gamora goes to her and caresses her face.] The Stone is on Vormir.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Satisfied.] Show me.

scene.description: [Cut to the pod taking Thor, Rocket and Groot to Nidavellir.]

dialogue.speaker: Groot
dialogue.line: [Irritably] I am Groot. (Translation: I need to tinkle.)

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Tinkle in the cup. We're not looking. What's there to see? What's a twig? Everybody's seen a twig.

dialogue.speaker: Groot
dialogue.line: [Still irritably] I am Groot. (Translation: But the cup is full.)

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [While looking out the rear portholes] Tree, pour what's in the cup out in space, and go in the cup again.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: You speak Groot?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Yes, they taught it on Asgard. It was an elective.

dialogue.speaker: Groot
dialogue.line: [Shortly] I am Groot. (Translation: How long 'till we get there?)

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: You'll know when we're there. Nivadellir's forge harnesses the power of a blazing neutron star. [Nostalgically] It's the birth place of my hammer. It's truly awesome.

scene.description: [Rocket turns to see Thor sitting sadly beside the window, and sighs.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: [To himself] Okay, time to be the captain. [Walks to a console near by Thor, presses two buttons] So, dead brother, huh? Yeah, that can be annoying.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Well, he's been dead before, but this time I think it really might be true.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: And you said your sister and your dad?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Both dead.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Still got a mom, though?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Killed by a dark elf.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: A best friend?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Stabbed through the heart.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Are you sure you're up to this particular murder mission?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Smiling widely but also trying to convince himself] Absolutely. Rage, vengeance, anger, loss, regret... they're all tremendous motivators. They really clear the mind. So I'm good to go.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Yeah, but this Thanos we're talking about... he's the toughest there is.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Well, he's never fought me.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Yeah, he has!

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: He's never fought me twice. And I'm getting a new hammer, don't forget.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Better be some hammer.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: You know, I'm 1,500 years old. I've killed twice as many enemies as that, and every one would have rather killed me, but none succeeded. I'm only alive because fate wants me alive. Thanos is the latest in a long line of bastards and he will be the latest to feel my vengeance. Fate wills it so.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: And what if you're wrong?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: If I'm wrong then... what more could I lose?

scene.description: [Thor sniffs and hastily wipes below his eye. He stands and seats himself at the front of the pod, beside Groot.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: [Under his breath] I could lose a lot. Me personally. I could lose a lot. [Rocket takes an eyeball from somewhere on his person] Okay. If fate does want you to kill that crapsack... you're gonna need more than one stupid eyeball. [He gives Thor the eyeball.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: What's this?

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: What's it look like? Some jerk lost a bet with me on on Contraxia.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: He gave you his eye?

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: He gave me 100 credits. I snuck in later that night and stole his eye.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Thank you, sweet rabbit.

scene.description: [Thor proceeds to put the eyeball in his socket. We are thankfully spared the explicit insertion.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Hmm. Huh? Oh. I would've washed that. The only way I could sneak it off Contraxia was up my...[beeping] Hey, we're here!

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Smacking his palm against the side of his head to get the eye calibrated] I don't think this thing works. Everything seems dark.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: It ain't the eye.

scene.description: [Nidavellir is dark and motionless as the three rings around it.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Something's wrong. The star's gone out. And the rings are frozen.

scene.description: [The pod flies through massive machinery, cold and inert. Screen title: NIDAVELLIR]
[The pod sets down; Thor, Rocket and Groot disembark and start walking through a seemingly abandoned and cluttered space. Groot is still playing his game.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: I hope these dwarves are better at forging than they are cleaning. Maybe they realized they live in a junk pile in the middle of space.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: This forge hasn't gone dark in centuries....

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: [Pauses, looking at a pedestal] You said Thanos had a gauntlet, right?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Yes. Why?

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Look anything like that? [In fact, it looks exactly like that]

dialogue.speaker: Groot
dialogue.line: [Uneasily] I am Groot.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Urgently] Go back to the pod.

scene.description: [Suddenly a massive figure storms towards them, flinging Thor away with one swing of his arm, and kicking Rocket and Groot against a wall of equipment.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Eitri, wait! Stop!

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: Thor?

scene.description: [Eitri is played by the legendary Peter Dinklage -- his giant size literally juxtaposing his name of dwarf.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: What happened here?

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: You were supposed to protect us. Asgard was supposed to protect us!

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Asgard is destroyed. [Thor scrambles to his feet and points. Eitri stop his attack on Thor. He now believes Thanos had destroyed Asgard and leaving him in a similar survivor role like Eitri himself.] Eitri, the glove. What did you do?

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: [He walks brokenly across the space to sit heavily, leaning against an ore skip. Rocket and Groot get to their feet, the sapling checking his game.] 300 dwarves lived on this ring. I thought if I did what he asked, they'd be safe. I made what he wanted. A device capable of harnessing the power of the stones. Then he killed everyone anyway. All except me. 'Your life is yours,' he said. 'But your hands are mine alone.' [He holds up his immobile metal fists, encased in hardened molten metal.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Eitri, this isn't about your hands. Every weapon you've ever designed: every ax, hammer, sword - it's all inside your head. Now I know it feels like all hope is lost. Trust me, I know. But together, you and I, we can kill Thanos.

scene.description: [Cut to Nebula suspended in the interrogation room seen earlier, while a technician puts her back together. Nebula ejects her eyepiece and snaps the neck of the tech when he comes close enough to replace it. She walks to a console, straightening her left arm, dragging her still-dislocated right foot behind her, and inputs a code.]

dialogue.speaker: Nebula
dialogue.line: Mantis, listen very carefully. I need you to meet me on Titan.

scene.description: [Cut to Peter Parker, Tony Stark, and Dr. Strange aboard the ship approaching the surface of Titan.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: [To Tony] Hey, what's going on?

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: I think we're here.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: I don't think this rig has a self-park function. [Urgently] Get your hand into this steering gimbal. Close those around it. You understand?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Yep, got it.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: This was meant for one big guy, so we gotta to move at the same time.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Okay. Okay. Ready.

scene.description: [The ringship is heading straight for the center of what looks like one of a colossal game of jacks.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: We might wanna turn. Turn! Turn! Turn!!

scene.description: [Iron Man armors up as the ringship clips the "jack" obliquely, but still losing a good third of its hull in the collision. Spider-Man throws up his helmet at the same time. Doctor Strange steps between them and creates the Shield of the Seraphim around them all, anticipating a rough landing.]
[The ship, now reduced to about 45%, plows through the dirt and stops, leaning slightly to one side. Screen title: TITAN.]
[Doctor Strange helps Tony, now de-helmeted, to his feet; they're both panting a little from the exertion of arrival.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [To Doctor Strange] You alright? [Panting] That was close. I owe you one.

scene.description: [Spider-Man descends from above in classically spider-like fashion.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Let me just say, if aliens wind up implanting eggs in my chest or something, and I eat one of you, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [While pointing at Peter] I don't wanna hear another single pop culture out of you for the rest of the trip. You understand?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: I'm trying to say that... something is coming.

scene.description: [A grenade rolls into view, and Peter, Strange and Tony get thrown well back when it fires its energy pulse. Star-Lord, Drax, and Mantis appear in the doorway]

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: [Yelling] THANOS!!!! [He flings a blade at Doctor Strange, who neatly deflects it with a mystical shield, and in return sends the Cloak of Levitation at Drax's face, half-smothering him and throwing him to the floor. Star-Lord and Iron Man have a brief dogfight until a magnetic disc pins Iron Man face-first to a structure.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: [Crawling backwards frantically from an anxious-looking Mantis] AH! Whoawhoawhoawhoa! PLEASE DON'T PUT YOUR EGGS IN ME!

scene.description: [Spider-Man shoots web at Mantis in a panic, pinning arms to her body just before Star-Lord flies at him feet-first, kicking him away.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Stay down, clown!

scene.description: [Star-Lord can't quite counter spider reflexes at first; he fires at Spider-Man, who extends his spider legs and leaps away, but an electric-like cord wraps around Spider-Man and his six new legs when he tries to attack, sending him rolling across the deck.]

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: [Struggling with the Cloak of Levitation] Die, blanket of death!

scene.description: [Iron Man pulls free of the magnet; the Cloak pulls free of Drax as soon as Iron Man has a bead on his opponent and a foot on his torso.]
[Star-Lord has Spider-Man in a head-lock, gun pointed at the smaller man's head.]
[Doctor Strange has a mystical shield of golden energy up, and stands ready at the third point of the triangle. Mantis has struggled to her feet behind Star-Lord, still covered with webbing.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Alright, everybody, stay where you are... chill the F out. [Star-Lord powers off his helmet] I'm gonna ask you this one time. Where's Gamora?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [De-helmeting] Yeah, I'll do you one better. Who's Gamora?

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: I'll do you one better. Why is Gamora?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Tell me where the girl is, or I swear to you, I'm gonna French-fry this little freak.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Let's do it! You shoot my guy, I blast him. Let's go! [Tony extends his nano-tech cannon, looking uncannily like an electric shark about to eat Drax's face.]

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: Do it, Quill! I can take it.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: No, he can't take it!

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Completely deadpan] She's right. You can't.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Oh yeah? You don't wanna tell me where she is? That's fine. I'll kill all three of you and beat it out of Thanos myself. [To Spider-Man] Starting with you.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Wait, what. Thanos? [Trying to inject clarity and sanity into the situation] Alright, let me ask you this one time: What master do you serve?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: What master do I serve? What am I supposed to say? "Jesus"?

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Getting it] You're from Earth?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: I'm not from Earth. I'm from Missouri.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yeah, that's on Earth, dip-shit. What are you hassling us for?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: [Sounding slightly crushed] So, you're not with Thanos?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Indignantly] With Thanos?! No, I'm here to kill Thanos! He took my girl- Wai- who are you?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: [De-helmets] We're the Avengers, man.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: You're the ones Thor told us about!

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: You know Thor!?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Yeah. Tall guy, not that good-looking, [Peter gives him an incredulous look] needed saving.

dialogue.speaker: Doctor Strange
dialogue.line: [Pause] Where is he now?

scene.description: [Cut to Nivadellir where Eitri is showing Thor, Rocket, and Groot the mold for Stormbreaker.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: This is the plan? We're gonna hit him with a brick?

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: It's a mold. A king's weapon. Meant to be the greatest in Asgard. In theory, it could even summon the Bifrost.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Did it have a name?

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: Stormbreaker.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: That's a bit much.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: So how do we make it?

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: You'll have to restart the forge. Awaken the heart of a dying star.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Rabbit, fire up the pod.

scene.description: [Cut to Titan where the remaining Avengers and the Guardians are starting to work together. Quill is measuring the planet's tilt.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: The heck happened to this planet? It's eight degrees off its axis. Gravitational pull is all over the place.

scene.description: [in the background, Mantis is jumping joyfully in a low gravity spot.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Yeah, we got one advantage. He's coming to us. We'll use it. All right, I have a plan. Or at least the beginnings of one. It's pretty simple. We draw him in, pin him down, get what we need. Definitely don't wanna dance with this guy. We just want the gauntlet.

scene.description: [Drax yawns.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Are you yawning? In the middle of this, while I'm breaking it down? Huh? Did you hear what I said?

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: I stopped listening after you said, "We need a plan."

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [To Quill] Okay, Mr. Clean is on his own page.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: See, "not winging it" isn't really what they do.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Uh, what exactly is it that they do?

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: [As fiercely as an 8-week-old kitten] Kick names, take ass.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: Yeah, that's right. [Agrees quietly as he settles into a stance facing the remaining Avengers.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Tony pauses with an expression of deep hopelessness] Alright, just get over here, please. Mr. Lord, can you get your folks to circle up?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: "Mr. Lord." Star-Lord is fine. [Motions to Drax and Mantis,]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: We gotta coalesce. 'Cause if all we come at him with is a plucky attitude....

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Dude, don't call us plucky. We don't know what it means. Alright, we're optimistic, yes. I like your plan. Except it sucks, so let me do the plan, and that way it might be really good. [Peter Parker follows the conversation back and forth like a squash rally.]

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: Tell him about the dance-off to save the universe.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: What dance-off?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: It's not a... it's not... it's nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Like in Footloose, the movie?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Excitedly] Exactly like Footloose. Is it still the greatest movie in history?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: It never was.

scene.description: [Quill frowns sadly at him.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Don't encourage this, alright?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: We're getting no help from Flash Gordon here.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Flash Gordon? By the way, that's a compliment. Don't forget, I'm half human. [Quill points at Stark and Parker] So that 50% of me that's stupid? That's 100% you.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Your math is blowing my mind.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: Excuse me, but... does your friend often do that?

scene.description: [Dr. Strange is sitting cross-legged, floating slightly above the ground, his hands poised in a mystic gesture with the Time Stone glowing brightly in the Eye of Agamotto setting. Green vapor-like energy flows from the stone, and more intricate magical energy patterns circle Dr. Strange's forearms. The Cloak of Levitation flows behind him as if the Stone is creating a strong breeze. His eyes are closed, and his head is jerking rapidly from side to side, the motion blurring, but resembling looking for something.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Strange, we alright?

scene.description: [Dr. Strange snaps out of his trance and falls forward, letting out a cry.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: You're back. You're alright.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Hey, what was that?

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Panting] I went forward in time to view alternate futures. To see all the possible outcomes of the coming conflict.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: How many did you see?

scene.description: Stephen Strange:14,000,605.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: How many did we win?

scene.description: [Dr. Strange stares intently at Tony for a moment.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Pause] One.

scene.description: [Cut to Thanos and Gamora appearing on sand dunes alternating with shallow pools around the base of a mountain. The sun is in full eclipse, lending eerie lighting to the scene. Screen title: VORMIR]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: The stone had better be up there... for your sister's sake.

scene.description: [The walk up the mountain seems to be long, but not difficult. Paths worn by centuries or more of feet lead up to the summit, where Thanos and Gamora encounter a floating hooded figure].

dialogue.speaker: Stonekeeper
dialogue.line: Welcome, Thanos, son of A'lars. Gamora, daughter of Thanos.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: You know us?

dialogue.speaker: Stonekeeper
dialogue.line: It is my curse to know all who journey here.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Where's the Soul Stone?

dialogue.speaker: Stonekeeper
dialogue.line: You should know... it extracts a terrible price.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I am prepared.

dialogue.speaker: Stonekeeper
dialogue.line: We all think that at first. [The figure touches down and glides out of the shadows, revealing the face of who we know to be Johann "The Red Skull" Schmidt from Captain America: The First Avenger.] We are all wrong.

scene.description: [The Stonekeeper guides them to a temple-like structure at the summit.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: How is it you know this place so well?

dialogue.speaker: Red Skull
dialogue.line: A lifetime ago, I, too, sought the stones. I even held one in my hand. But it cast me out, banished me here. Guiding others to a treasure I cannot possess.

scene.description: [They stop on a semicircular engraving overlooking a sheer drop. It descends in three shallow steps to a final half-circle cutout, the whole bisected by a deep cut that runs between the two spires behind them. Far, far below is a full circle with similar engraved decoration.]

dialogue.speaker: Red Skull
dialogue.line: What you seek lies before you. As does what you fear.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: What's this?

dialogue.speaker: Red Skull
dialogue.line: The price. Soul hold a special place among the Infinity Stones. You might say it has a certain wisdom.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Tell me what it needs.

dialogue.speaker: Red Skull
dialogue.line: To ensure that whoever possesses it... understands its power.... The stone demands a sacrifice.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Of what?

dialogue.speaker: Red Skull
dialogue.line: In order to take the stone, you must lose that which you love. A soul, for a soul.

scene.description: [Gamora begins to laugh at the irony of the situation.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: All my life, I dreamed of a day... a moment when you would get what you deserved. And I was always so disappointed. But now... you kill and torture... and you call it mercy. The universe has judged you. You asked it for a prize, and it told you no. You failed. And do you wanna know why? Because you love nothing. No one.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Turns to face Gamora with tears in his eyes.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: Really? Tears?

dialogue.speaker: Red Skull
dialogue.line: They're not for him.

scene.description: [Gamora looks at the Red Skull, and as her bitter smile fades, realizes what is about to happen, as do we.... ]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: No! This isn't love!

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Thoroughly convicted.] I ignored my destiny once. I cannot do that again. Even for you. [Gamora stares down unseeing for a moment, then up at the resolution on his face. She grabs the red-jeweled dagger from his belt with lightning reflexes, triggers the blades and stabs herself in the stomach... except it's only bubbles.] I'm sorry, little one. [He grabs Gamora by the arm and walks inexorably to the precipice.]

dialogue.speaker: Gamora
dialogue.line: No!

scene.description: [She tries in vain to break from his grasp, much like she tried to pull free from the Child of Thanos so many years ago, but, pain showing clearly on his face, he throws her over the edge, and watches sorrowfully as she falls to her death. Light pulses overhead as the sacrifice is correctly accomplished.]
[Thanos finds himself lying in one of the shallow pools back at the base of the mountain. He opens his hand and sees that he now has the orange Soul Stone.]
[Cut to the Quinjet where Sam is piloting Rhodey, Steve, Natasha, Wanda, and Vision.]

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: [Walking up to the pilot's seat] Drop to 2600, heading 0-3-0.

dialogue.speaker: Sam Wilson
dialogue.line: I hope you're right about this, Cap. Or we're gonna land a lot faster than you want to.

scene.description: [The Quinjet passes through a camouflage force field into Wakanda's Golden City's valley and lands at the airfield outside the palace. King T'Challa and the Dora Milaje approach to greet the arrivals]

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: [Walking with King T'Challa and a band of the Kingsguard to the landing pad] When you said we were going to open Wakanda to the rest of the world... this is not what I imagined.

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: And what did you imagine?

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: The Olympics. Maybe even a Starbucks.

scene.description: [The occupants of the Quinjet disembark, Steve and Natasha leading, followed by Bruce and Rhodey, with Vision and Wanda slowly taking up the rear.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [To Rhodey] Should we bow?

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: [Seriously] Yeah, he's a king.

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: Seems like I'm always thanking you for something. [Shaking hands with King T'Challa.]

scene.description: [Bruce bows awkwardly to King T'Challa.]

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: [Mock shocked] What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: Uh, we don't do that here. [He dissuades Bruce with a motion of his hand; Bruce shoots Rhodey a look, and is answered with a big grin] So how big of an assault can we expect?

scene.description: [The group begins to walk back into the administrative building.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Uh, sir, I think you can expect quite a big assault.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: How we looking?

dialogue.speaker: King T'Challa
dialogue.line: You will have my Kingsguard, the Border Tribe, the Dora Milaje, and...

dialogue.speaker: Bucky Barnes
dialogue.line: [Smiling as he walks toward Steve, passing some Kingsguard taking Vision and Wanda to another facility] A semi-stable, 100-year-old man.

scene.description: [The two friends share a hug.]

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: How you been, Buck?

dialogue.speaker: Bucky Barnes
dialogue.line: Uh, not bad, for the end of the world.

scene.description: [In Shuri's lab, Shuri scans the Stone with her kimoyo beads while Vision lies on the examination table. She flips her hand over and studies the hologram projected over her palm.]

dialogue.speaker: Shuri
dialogue.line: Whoa. The structure is polymorphic.

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Right, we had to attach each neuron non-sequentially.

dialogue.speaker: Shuri
dialogue.line: Why didn't you just reprogram the synapses to work collectively?

scene.description: [Vision looks at Bruce as if to ask the same thing.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Uncertainly] Because, we didn't think of it.

dialogue.speaker: Shuri
dialogue.line: [Reassuringly, with a smile] I'm sure you did your best.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: Can you do it?

dialogue.speaker: Shuri
dialogue.line: Yes, but there are more than two trillion neurons here. One misalignment could cause a cascade of circuit failures. [To King T'Challa] It will take time, brother.

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: How long?

dialogue.speaker: Shuri
dialogue.line: As long as you can give me.

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: [Her kimoyo beads chime an alarm; she flicks one bead into her palm, where it projects the globe with a pulsing location marker] Something's entered the atmosphere.

scene.description: [Outside, Sam and Bucky look up at the sky]

dialogue.speaker: Sam Wilson
dialogue.line: [Over the Avengers' comm] Hey, Cap, we got a situation here.

scene.description: [The defense shield over the Golden City destroys one of the alien vessels when it slams into the field at full attack acceleration.]

dialogue.speaker: Bucky Barnes
dialogue.line: God, I love this place.

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: [also outside, and now in full War Machine armor watching three more ships burn through the sky] Yeah, don't start celebrating yet, guys. We got more incoming outside the dome.

scene.description: [The shock waves and debris from the ship landings destroy acres of forest and boil up against the dome. The lab has an excellent view of the landing sites. Captain America and Black Panther look at each other in concern over the scope of what they'll be facing.]

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: [Struggling to sit up and slide off the exam table] It's too late. We need to destroy the stone now.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: [Moving toward Vision] Vision, get your ass back on the table.

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: We will hold them off. [He, Okoye and the guards head for the door.]

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: [To Wanda] Wanda, as soon as the stone's out of his head... you blow it to hell.

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: I will.

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: Evacuate the city. Engage all defense procedures. [He stops, turns, and points at Steve] And get this man a shield.

scene.description: [Cut to Nivadellir where Rocket is in the pod, and Thor, without any environmental suit, jumps from the hull onto the ring surface with a cable in his hand attached to the pod.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: I don't think you get the scientifics here. These rings are gigantic. You wanna get them moving, you're gonna need something a lot bigger to yank 'em loose.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Leave that to me.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Leave that to you? Buddy, you're in space. All you got is a rope and a--

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Thor begins to swing the pod around him in a circle. Rocket screams. Thor builds up speed with three good loops then slacks his grip enough to send the pod shooting straight away from Nidavellir, trailing him behind it like a kite tail.] Fire the engines!

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: [Rocket shakes it off and puts the proverbial pedal to the metal.] Nnnyah!

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [As the pod skims over the surface of the next ring out, Thor reaches down and digs one hand into the surface, then both feet, finally getting a foothold against the forward motion of the pod. The ice-like accumulation around the ring axis crackles.] MORE... POWER... RABBIT!

scene.description: [Thor commits bicep porn while Rocket accelerates for all he's worth. Finally the rings spin free, realigning into effective configuration as the star bursts back into life.]

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: Well done, boy.

scene.description: [Thor, clutching the pod's forward windows, points to the star.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: That's Nivadellir!

scene.description: [Rocket gazes amazed at the blazing core. An iris on the cladding around the star opens, firing pure stellar heat through the ring portals and into the forge... until the damaged mechanism fails, crumbles loose and slams shut. The iris closes and the beam of light trails off.]

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: Damn it.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: "Damn it"? What's "damn it"?

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: The mechanism is crippled.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: What?

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: With the iris closed I can't heat the metal.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: How long will it take to heat?

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: A few minutes, maybe more. Why?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Standing up on the pod hull] I'm gonna hold it open.

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: That's suicide.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: So is facing Thanos without that ax. [He leaps from the pod to the star's iris.]

scene.description: [Cut to the Wakandan battlefield. Carriers hover over the ground with Wakandan soldiers and Natasha, Steve and Bucky on board; Rhodey and Sam keep pace overhead, and Bruce is in the Hulkbuster armor.]

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: How we looking, Bruce?

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Leaping jogging along, keeping up with the carriers, and utterly delighted] Yeah, I think I'm getting the hang of it. Wow! It's like being the Hulk without actually-- [he stumbles on a rock, and a carrier goes by, from which Okoye gives him a dubious look. He stands] I'm okay. I'm okay.

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: I got two heat signatures breaking through the tree line.

scene.description: [The heat signatures are Proxima Midnight and Cull Obsidian.]

[The carrier pilots swerve into U-turns, causing their craft to tilt and allowing the practiced soldiers to slide over one side into a run, never coming to a complete halt. A Dora Milaje shouts a command nearby as the last Wakandans join ranks.]

dialogue.speaker: Jabari Warriors
dialogue.line: MIE EFFA! (Win them!) YA HU! MIE EFFA! YA HU! MIE EFFA! YA HU! MIE EFFA! YA HU! MIE EFFA! YA HU! [M'Baku, Lord of the Jabari, rallies his soldiers with a war chant. He stops as King T'Challa nears him.]

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: [Clasps wrists with M'Baku] Thank you for standing with us.

dialogue.speaker: M'Baku
dialogue.line: [Translated from Xhosa] Of course, brother.

scene.description: [The Black Panther, Captain America, and Black Widow walk to the edge of the barrier, where Proxima Midnight and Cull Obsidian stand. Proxima tests the strength of the barrier by drawing her sword across it consideringly.]

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: Where's your other friend?

dialogue.speaker: Proxima Midnight
dialogue.line: You will pay for his life with yours. Thanos will have that stone.

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: That's not gonna happen.

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: You are in Wakanda now. Thanos will have nothing but dust and blood.

dialogue.speaker: Proxima Midnight
dialogue.line: We... have blood to spare. [She brandishes her sword with a snarl, and the ships behind her start raising their outer hulls to allow their "passengers" to disembark.]

scene.description: [The three heroes return to the massed forces.]

dialogue.speaker: Bucky Barnes
dialogue.line: [A touch sardonically] Did they surrender?

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: Not exactly.

scene.description: [The Black Panther leads the Wakandans in the war cry "Yibambe!" telling them to hold fast as the Outriders bound toward the barrier; Proxima drops her sword arm down in the signal to attack.]

dialogue.speaker: Bucky Barnes
dialogue.line: [Flatly, astonished at the numbers of Outriders] What the hell.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: Looks like we pissed her off.

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: [Horrified, as the Outriders bombard the force-field, squeezing limbs and bodies partly through only to be bisected.] They're killing themselves.

scene.description: [As a few Outriders managed to squeeze through intact, the Border Tribe take a knee and raise their shields. The Kingsguard behind them level their sonic spears over their comrades' shoulders, and on Black Panther's command, fire at the approaching monsters. The Winter Soldier uses his M-249 machine gun, and Bruce fires the Hulkbuster's hand repulsors.]

dialogue.speaker: Sam Wilson
dialogue.line: [Sending Redwings into the fight as he flies, swooping to fire at them with his Steyr pistols] You seen the teeth on those things?

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: Alright, back up, Sam. You're gonna get your wings singed. [He flies over the heaviest concentration of Outriders and drops a barrage of mines, all exploding fantastically.]

scene.description: [Everyone notices a pack of Outriders starting to run around the force-field to the right of the defenders' position.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Cap, if these things circle the perimeter and get in behind us... there's nothing between them and Vision.

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: [Grimly] Them we better keep 'em in front of us.

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: [To the Black Panther] How do we do that?

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: We open the barrier. [Putting his comm to his mouth] On my signal, open North-West Section Seventeen.

dialogue.speaker: Dome Control
dialogue.line: [Nervous and unsure] Requesting confirmation, my King. You said open the barrier?

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: On my signal.

dialogue.speaker: M'Baku
dialogue.line: [To Okoye] This will be the end of Wakanda.

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: Then it will be the noblest ending in history.

scene.description: [Captain America readies one of his Vibranium hand guards. The Black Panther shouts a command in Xhosa; the Border Tribesmen disengage their shields and stand, as the Black Panther walks out in front of them, never taking his eyes off the enemy.]

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: WAKANDA FOREVER!!!! [He crosses his arms in the Wakandan salute and closes his Black Panther helmet, charging for the barrier. The heroes and leaders are at the fore of the charge. Halfway to the barrier, the Black Panther shouts into his comm] Now!

scene.description: [The Outriders pour through, distracted from trying to find any other access. The Black Panther and Captain America pull ahead rapidly due to their enhancements, and literally leap into battle.]

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: [Over his comm] How much longer, Shuri?

dialogue.speaker: Shuri
dialogue.line: We've barely begun, brother. [A delicate and intricate construction of gold light hovers at her eye level; as she manipulates it, the waldo tools reproduce her commands on the Mind Stone itself.]

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: You might want to pick up the pace.

scene.description: [Simultaneously, Thor prepares to open the iris of Nidavellir.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Allfathers, give me strength.

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: You understand, boy? You're about to take the full force of a star. It'll kill you.

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: Only if I die. [Takes deep breaths.]

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: [Boggled] Yes. That's what... "killing you" means.

scene.description: [Thor grasps the two levers and pulls them down and towards himself, slowly opening the iris. The stream of stellar energy blasts pasts him and into the forge once again.]

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: Hold it! Hold it, Thor!

scene.description: [Eitri watches the metal ingots melt while Thor is looking increasingly charred. Finally, Eitri is able to tip the cauldron, pouring the metal into the mold just as Thor passes out. The jet carries him into the forge, Rocket follows hastily and landing after Thor bounces limply off a structure to land on the floor. Groot finally looks up from his game at the thump Thor's body makes.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: [Kneeling over Thor] Thor! Say something. Come on. Thor, you okay? [Thor looks far from "okay".]

scene.description: [Eitri clumsily and urgently pulls the mold, still glowing red-hot, onto the floor, breaking it loose from its frame, then starts punching the mold itself with his metal fists to free the ax.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: I think he's dying!

dialogue.speaker: Eitri
dialogue.line: He needs the ax! Where's the handle? Tree, help me find the handle!

scene.description: [Stormbreaker's two sections -- the hammer and the ax-blade -- lay glowing on the floor. Groot looks sadly at Thor, then scowls with determination. He stands, and extends his fingers towards Stormbreaker, growing them at extraordinary speed. As he twines them around the two parts, he cries out at the burning pain but does not hesitate, slamming them together and locking them permanently into one structure. He raises it above his head, and with a mighty cry, chops his extended arm with his other hand to sever it at the right length.Thor's fingers twitch, and the new weapon levitates in a crackle of lightning echoed by the sparks between Thor's fingers.]

[The remaining Avengers and Wakandans are struggling against the Outriders. The Winter Soldier goes down, and fights off Outrider fangs snapping at his head. Captain America and the Black Panther still fight side-by-side. War Machine hovers over the breach, pouring ammunition into the flood of bodies until a huge hammer -- Cull Obsidian's -- knocks him out of the sky and to the ground. The Hulkbuster is dogpiled and pinned.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: There’s too many of them! GYAH! AAAAHHHHH!

scene.description: [Suddenly, a large beam of rainbow-hued light lands in the middle of the action, and an ax flies out of it, wreathed with lightning and tearing through the Outriders, freeing the heroes. It flies back to the light and into its master's hand just as the beam cuts out, revealing Thor, Groot and Rocket [The Avengers theme swelling triumphantly at their arrival] who chambers a round in his large gun. Black Widow, Captain America and the Black Panther pause in astonishment. Proxima Midnight and Cull Obsidian pause in apprehension.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: [Opening the Hulkbuster's helm and laughing with joy] AH-hahaha! You guys are so screwed now!

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: BRING ME THANOS! [He charges toward the hordes of Outriders, followed by Groot and Rocket, lightning gathering around him until he finally launches himself into the air, lands in the densest concentration of Outriders and makes a crater where they had stood.]

scene.description: [Cut to Titan, where Thanos arrives, finding only fresh debris from Ebony Maw's ship.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Sitting on what may have been plaza steps once] Oh, yeah, you're much more of a "Thanos."

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I take it the Maw is dead. This day extracts a heavy toll. Still, he accomplished his mission.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: You may regret that. He brought you face-to-face with the Master of the Mystic Arts.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: And where do you think he brought you? [Star-Lord crouches behind wreckage with his weapon ready, behind Thanos and to his left; Spider-Man peeks from above and behind Doctor Strange.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Let me guess. Your home?

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [Smiling reminiscently] It was. And it was beautiful. [Thanos curls his gauntleted fist and activates the Reality Stone to show Strange Titan before it was destroyed -- green lawns, intact buildings, water-filled ponds, strolling citizens, the jack-like structures hovering and connected to the ground-based buildings with beams of energy.] Titan was like most planets. Too many mouths, and not enough to go around. And when we faced extinction, I offered a solution.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Genocide.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: But at random, dispassionate, fair to rich and poor alike. They called me a madman. And what I predicted came to pass. [He relaxes his fist; the Stone stops glowing and the illusion fades back into the true state of Titan.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Sarcastically] Congratulations. You're a prophet.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I'm a survivor.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: Who wants to murder trillions.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: With all six stones, I could simply snap my fingers, and they would all cease to exist. I call that... mercy.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Stands] And then what?

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I finally rest... and watch the sun rise on a grateful universe. The hardest choices require the strongest wills.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [He summons his Mandalas, entering a fighting pose] I think... you'll find... our will... equal to yours.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Ours? [He looks up to a see a chunk of wreckage descending rapidly on him, too rapidly to react -- and powered by Iron Man. He is subsequently crushed by it.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Flying in] Piece of cake, Quill.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Triggers his mask and follows] Yeah, if your goal was to piss him off!

scene.description: [The wreckage on top of Thanos erupts in purple, as he bellows in rage. He turns the hovering fragments into a flock of bats with the Reality Stone and swarms Iron Man with them, driving him back through the ruins.]

[Spider-Man webs his eyes, and swings in to kick him in the face at the same time that Drax leaps from cover, blades in both hands, to knee-slide behind Thanos and try for a tendon slide across the back of the Titan's knee.]

[Doctor Strange jumps through a portal and summons a sword of golden energy, dueling with Thanos while Drax attacks similarly on his other side. Thanos punches Drax through a ruined wall, then shatters the blade with one hand and tears the web from his eyes. He advances on Doctor Strange and kicks at him, but Strange's shield absorbs the damage -- the Cloak lifts him free of the ground.]

[Star-Lord has been making his way back on the ground, and shoots Thanos from behind. Thanos uses the Power Stone to shoot balls of energy at Star-Lord while Star-Lord leaps towards Thanos using magical platforms thrown in his path by Doctor Strange, the last one placed above Thanos' head so Star-Lord can flip over him and slap a mine on Thanos' back. Star-Lord sticks his landing, he disengages his helmet, flips Thanos a bird and falls backward into a portal.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Boom!

scene.description: [The explosion knocks Thanos to his knees and dazes him briefly.]

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [Whispers to the Cloak of Levitation] Do not let him close his fist. [The Cloak swoops off Doctor Strange's shoulders and wraps itself tightly around Thanos' armored hand, who starts tugging at this unexpected wrapping.]

scene.description: [Doctor Strange starts throwing portals everywhere. Spider-Man leaps through one on Thanos' left]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: Magic! [He punches Thanos in the head and vanishes through a portal to the lower right before reappearing above Thanos] More magic! [He yanks Thanos' head down hard, then leaps into a portal in front of him. He leaps through another portal high and behind Thanos] Magic with a kick! [Delivers a flying kick and falls feet-first into an exit, then appears on his right] Magic with a--

scene.description: [Before he can finish Thanos turns, grabbing him from the air, and throwing him to the ground, with his hand around his neck.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Insect!

scene.description: [He then throws him at Doctor Strange, knocking them both down. Thanos finally tears the Cloak away and is then promptly surrounded by fiery explosions as Iron Man bombards him. He sucks all the flame into the gauntlet with the Power Stone and fires it in a stream at Iron Man, hitting him dead on and sending him far away, plowing through a massive fallen machine.]

[Spider-Man leaps from behind, more conventionally this time, while Thanos concentrates his fire on Iron Man, webs the gauntlet and drops down in front of him, pulling hard -- but Thanos yanks on the web-line, pulling the much lighter teenager towards him, and punching him on his way past. He tears the webbing free of the gauntlet just in time for a small spaceship to attempt to crash-land on him.]
[The ship drags Thanos along for a distance, burying him under debris. He stands just as the pilot leaps in a great arc to punch him, landing in front of him with an energy-blade at the ready.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Well, well.

dialogue.speaker: Nebula
dialogue.line: You should have killed me.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: It would've been a waste of parts!

dialogue.speaker: Nebula
dialogue.line: [She runs at Thanos, attacking him with her sword] Where's Gamora?!

scene.description: [Thanos punches her away. Doctor Strange uses the Crimson Bands of Cyttorak to pinion the gauntlet, pulling Thanos' fingers open and trying to pry the gauntlet off his hand.]
[Thanos tries to pull free, as Drax slides in from his right, kicking his knee and knocking him off-balance, then wrapping himself around Thanos' kneeling leg.]
[Star-Lord shoots a electric trap onto the ground to Thanos' right, the tangle-field holding down his unarmored hand.]
[Spider-Man swings in, webs Thanos' chest then wraps it around behind him, digging his Iron Spider legs into the ground to anchor himself.]
[Doctor Strange opens a portal straight above Thanos' out of which drops Mantis, landing on the Titan's shoulders, her hands on his temples. He bellows as she tries to put him under.]

[Iron Man, having returned, is pulling on the gauntlet. Doctor Strange reapplies the Crimson Bands of Cyttorak to reinforce the trap's hold on Thanos' right hand, and the Cloak helps him pull. Thanos is finally subdued enough to incapacitate, not fully asleep.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [While pulling] Is he under? Don't let up.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: [Starting to cry] Be quick. He is very strong.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Parker, help! Get over here. [Spider-Man drops his web-line, and hurries to help Tony with the gauntlet] She can't hold him much longer. Let's go.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Flies over to join the others, stands in front of Thanos, tauntingly] I thought you'd be harder to catch. For the record, this was my plan. Not so strong now, huh? Where is Gamora?

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: My Gamora...?

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: No, bull-shit. Where is she?

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: [Shocked] He is in anguish.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Good.

dialogue.speaker: Mantis
dialogue.line: [Crying] He… he mourns.

dialogue.speaker: Drax
dialogue.line: What does this monster have to mourn?

dialogue.speaker: Nebula
dialogue.line: Gamora.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [Pause] What?

dialogue.speaker: Nebula
dialogue.line: [Realizing with horror and sadness what has happened] He took her to Vormir. He came back with the Soul Stone... but she didn't.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Frasps the danger immediately and de-helmets] Okay, Quill, you gotta cool it right now, you understand?

scene.description: [Quill slowly turns to Thanos,]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [Shouting his pleads desperately] Don't, don't, don't engage, we've almost got this off!

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: Tell me she's lying. [Enraged] Asshole! Tell me you didn't do it!

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I... had... to.

dialogue.speaker: Peter Quill
dialogue.line: [While starting to tear up; quietly] No, you didn't…! No, you didn't…! [He continues to rage and then pistol-whipping Thanos twice in the face, causing Mantis to let go in pain.] NO, YOU DIDN'T!

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: Quill!

scene.description: [Iron Man leaps for Star-Lord's arm, re-helmeting and leaving Spider-Man to pull off the gauntlet.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [To the struggling Star-Lord] Hey, stop! Hey, stop! Stop! Hey, stop! Stop!

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: It's coming! It's coming! It's coming! [Getting the fingers completely loose] I got it! I got it.... !

scene.description: [Thanos wakes completely, now well and truly furious. He head-butts Mantis, grabbing the cuff of the gauntlet just as it is sliding off his hand, causing Spider-Man to stumble back, and then throwing Mantis away off his shoulders.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: [Seeing Mantis with far too much air under her] Oh, God. [He jumps and wraps his arms and legs around her, extending his spider legs to form a roll cage for a safe landing.]

scene.description: [Thanos kicks Drax off his right leg and into Nebula and Star-Lord, knocking them down. He yanks on the Crimson Bands holding his right hand to throw Doctor Strange far away, and swats away Iron Man and his repulsor shots. The remaining Guardians jump up and charge him again, but he fires a pulse of indigo energy at them that knocks the three of them completely unconscious.]

[Iron Man zooms back in, his nanite arm cannon manifested, and is head-butted to the ground. Thanos looks at him for a beat, then raises the gauntlet towards Titan's moon. Iron Man stares, aghast. Thanos uses a combination of the Power and Space Stones to shatter the moon's surface, then bring the debris down on the field of battle at speed. Iron Man powers out of the way but is caught by a chunk of moon about the size of a baseball field, slamming him into the ground. The Guardians go sailing into the air from the rebound.]
[Back in Wakanda, Shuri is working steadily to complete the Mind Stone's removal; Wanda stands by tensely]

[The Kingsguard, Borderers and Jabari have little success going against Cull Obsidian's chained hammer -- he either sends them flying or punches them into the ground. The Black Panther gets free of his other sorties, leaps and uses all his collected kinetic energy behind a punch that lays Obsidian flat.]

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: [Having found a clear spot] Come and get some, space dogs! [Another wave of Outriders heads right for the raccoon-oid. The Winter Soldier, having come up behind Rocket, grabs him with his mechanical arm, holds him at arms length and spins 540 degrees, firing his own M-249 at the same time.] Come on, get some, get some! Come on, get some! [The Winter Soldier drops Rocket, who looks up at him with an impressed gleam] How much for the gun?

dialogue.speaker: Bucky Barnes
dialogue.line: [Snaps off another burst] Not for sale.

dialogue.speaker: Rocket
dialogue.line: Okay, how much for the arm? [The Winter Soldier just gives him a look and moves off] Oh, I'll get that arm.

scene.description: [The tides of battle cause Thor, using Stormbreaker to great effect, and Captain America together. They take a breather.]

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: [Panting] New haircut?

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: [Grinning] Notice you've copied my beard.

scene.description: [Captain America nods, wearily gesturing at his own face with a shield-covered hand. Groot skewers three Outriders with his right arm.]

dialogue.speaker: Thor
dialogue.line: By the way, this is a friend of mine. Tree. [Gestures towards Groot with Stormbreaker]

dialogue.speaker: Groot
dialogue.line: [In full battle snarl] I AM GROOT! (Translation: You gonna help me or what?!)

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: [Formally, but bemused] I am Steve Rogers.

scene.description: [In Shuri's lab, a deep rumbling can be heard even at their height. Wanda looks down on the battlefield, and sees movement through the blazing forest between the troopships and the dome. When the disturbance reaches the edge of the trees, it turns into vast moving mounds of earth that easily bypass the force field and emerge -- Threshers, sets of massive, motorized spiked wheels, intended for nothing more than shredding everything in their paths.]

dialogue.speaker: T'Challa
dialogue.line: Fall back! Fall back now!

scene.description: [Wanda watches as at least one set of Threshers separates into individual wheels and starts veering all over the battlefield, and then looks anxiously back at Vision]

dialogue.speaker: James Rhodes
dialogue.line: Focus that fire on the left flank, Sam.

dialogue.speaker: Sam Wilson
dialogue.line: I'm doing it. [The two fliers use their firepower to crack a Thresher but cannot find a weak spot.]

scene.description: [Black Widow with her escrima sticks and Okoye with her augmented spear have drifted together when they're suddenly in the path of a Thresher. Both women cringe at their seemingly inevitable shredding when the Scarlet Witch lands in front of both of them, eyes glowing red, lifting the whole Thresher well clear of the ground. Looking behind her, the friendly forces have scattered and replaced by a charging mob of Outriders -- the perfect place to throw a Thresher. Black Widow straightens with a pleased smile, Okoye with an amazed look.]

dialogue.speaker: Okoye
dialogue.line: [A touch indignant] Why was she up there all this time?

scene.description: [The Children of Thanos help answer that question.]

dialogue.speaker: Proxima Midnight
dialogue.line: She's on the field. Take it.

scene.description: [Corvus Glaive kills one of the guards just outside the lab, alerting Shuri to the problem. She starts hastily disconnecting her equipment from Vision's systems; he gasps at the sensations. The Dora Milaje engages Glaive but is sent skidding across the floor. Shuri finishes her shutdown, grabs one of her sonic panther-paws and fires at Glaive. The Dora attacks again, and Glaive sends both her and Shuri through the balcony railing and onto the main lab floor.]
[Vision is not where Corvus Glaive expects to find him. Vision is, in fact, charging at him and knocking him out the window to fall many meters down the face of Mount Bashenga.]

dialogue.speaker: Sam Wilson
dialogue.line: Guys, we got a Vision situation here. [He's tackled by a leaping Outrider and grounded.]

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: Somebody get to Vision!

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: I got him! [Bruce has figured out the Hulkbusters repulsor thrusters and makes a beeline for the android.]

dialogue.speaker: Wanda Maximoff
dialogue.line: On my way. [She is clobbered by Proxima Midnight's pommel and rolls down into the large ditch from the Thresher before she can move.]

dialogue.speaker: Proxima Midnight
dialogue.line: [Jumping down next to the Scarlet Witch] He'll die alone. As will you.

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: She's not alone.

scene.description: [Okoye silently brandishes her spear on the other side of Proxima and nods at Black Widow.]

dialogue.speaker: Proxima Midnight
dialogue.line: Euuyaaah! [She leaps for Black Widow, who has joined her sticks into a full staff. She blocks Proxima's blow with an electrical crackle while Okoye runs around the slope to also attack from the front.]

scene.description: [Corvus Glaive kicks Vision, knocking him down; as he attempts to rise again, Cull Obsidian shows up and swings his hammer in a full arc, throwing Vision even further. He painfully starts to climb to his feet again when a whooshing overhead interrupts the fight as Bruce Banner lands the Hulkbuster between the aliens and the android. He takes a defensive stance, pointing one hand's repulsor at each.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Oh no, oh no you don't. This isn't going to be like New York, pal. This suit's already kicked the crap out of the Hulk-- [Cull Obsidian jumps forward, grabs Bruce's right arm and Bruce in reflex grabs Obsidian's hammer; a jet fires, taking the two of them in a random direction, to the base of a waterfall.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Guys! Vision needs backup now! [Obsidian pulls the Hulkbuster up and kicks it in the small of the back.] [Trying to change into the Hulk while fighting Cull Obsidian in the Hulkbuster armor] Hulk. Hulk, I know you like making your entrance at the last second, well, this is it, man. This is the last, last second. [Bruce extends his left hand protectively; Obsidian grabs the armor's hand, chops the shoulder joint with a relatively small axe then does a roll over Bruce's back to leverage snapping off the Hulkbuster's whole arm] Ahhhhh! Hulk! Hulk! HULK!

dialogue.speaker: Hulk
dialogue.line: [Banner's face briefly becomes the Hulk] NOOOO!!!

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: Oh, screw you, ya big green asshole! I'll do it myself! [To Obsidian] Come on!

scene.description: [He charges the alien, jumps into the air and delivers an effective punch with his remaining hand -- swat, punch, hammer -- except that blow is caught by Obsidian, who punches back, knocking Bruce flat. Obsidian changes his left hand armor into a pointed weapon, and lunges forward to deliver a likely fatal blow, when Bruce grabs the detached Hulkbuster arm out of the water, holding it so Obsidian impales that instead, and slaps the controls.]

dialogue.speaker: Bruce Banner
dialogue.line: See you later, Alligator! [The repulsors fire, taking Cull Obsidian high into the air -- high enough, in fact, to intersect the defense dome. The Hulkbuster arm drags Obsidian against the field to grotesque destructive effect, ending in a very final explosion.] Hulk, we got a lot to figure out, pal.

scene.description: [Proxima Midnight alternates heavy blows between her two opponents, but all three of them duck as a single-wheel Thresher tears overhead, the ditch sparing them most of the danger from the wheel-blades. Proxima uses the distraction to kick Black Widow in the face, sending her to the ground. She then grabs Okoye by the shoulder and weapon and throws her meters away.]

[Simultaneously, Corvus Glaive and Vision struggle in the forest at the foot of Mount Bashenga. Glaive grasps Vision's shoulder and uses the leverage to plunge his blade once more into the android's chest.]

dialogue.speaker: Corvus Glaive
dialogue.line: I thought you were formidable, machine. But you're dying, like any man. [He yanks his blade out, and Vision collapses. As he bends over his fallen opponent to retrieve the Stone, he's tackled by Captain America at full speed.]

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: Get outta here! [He exchanges blows with Glaive, using his arm-shields as offence as well as defense, then turns to Vision again] GO!

scene.description: [Black Widow splits her staff back into a pair of sticks to block Proxima Midnight's sword blows, and finally knocks it from her hand. The alien takes to her bare fists instead, knocks down and pins the Black Widow. Proxima triggers an arm-blade from her left-arm armor, and stabs at Black Widow, who barely manages to block the blade with her crossed sticks. As the edge starts to dig into Black Widow's neck anyway, scarlet energy grabs the alien and tosses her into the air right into the path of another passing Thresher. Dark blue blood spatters the women below. The Scarlet Witch sits up, sighing with relief, her hands still shimmering.]

dialogue.speaker: Natasha Romanoff
dialogue.line: That was really gross.

scene.description: [Captain America keeps blocking Corvus Glaive's staff weapon using his shields, finally knocking it from the alien's hands just before he's thrown over a fallen tree and pinned, Glaive's hand at his throat. Even with his physical abilities, Captain America's struggling -- until a glaive-blade pierces Glaive's chest, and is pushed all the way through. Vision raises his enemy in a perfect mirror of the first attack on him, and holds him for a moment, before dropping Glaive's corpse to one side and collapsing exhaustively.]

dialogue.speaker: Steve Rogers
dialogue.line: [helping him back up] I thought I told you to go.

dialogue.speaker: Vision
dialogue.line: We don't trade lives, Captain.

scene.description: [The remaining Guardians and Avengers are dealing with the gravitic aftermath of dumping a large chunk of moon onto an unstable planet's surface. The unconscious Guardians are flying upwards uncontrollably, moon-chunks are still making fiery ballistic in-bounds, and random debris and massive rocks are floating in any possible direction. Spider-Man is well-equipped to handle this physically, even if he's freaking out emotionally.]

dialogue.speaker: Peter Parker
dialogue.line: [Webs Mantis] I got you! I got you! [Snags Drax, securing both of them to something not moving] I'm sorry I can't remember anybody's names! [Reels in Star-Lord]

scene.description: [The Cloak of Levitation sets Doctor Strange down on a relatively stable outcrop as Thanos extricates himself from rubble. The Sorcerer Supreme makes a few passes with his hands, producing the familiar golden magic filigree circles, and slams his hands down on the rock before him, invoking the Seven Suns of Cinnibus as a lightning-like effect of immense heat jumping from rock to rock until it reaches Thanos, sending him flying -- but he makes use of the erratic gravity to keep control and fire back a blast from the Power Stone.]

[Doctor Strange blocks the purple plume with a wall of Mirror Dimension, which he then pushes back at Thanos. It shatters around the Titan, who suctions the magic into a miniature black hole with the Space Stone, volleying it back at Doctor Strange. Just in time, Doctor Strange raises a shield and changes the dark energy into a swarm of aqua butterflies which return to their master.]

[Before Thanos can counterattack again, Doctor Strange levitates and invokes the Images of Ikonn, giving him arms like a Hindu deity before dozens of Strange replications rush away, forming a circular wall around a snarling Thanos. They call cast magical cords, wrapping around Thanos' torso, arms and hands; he struggles to close his gauntleted fist, and uses the Soul and Power Stones to discover the real Doctor Strange among the many copies, blowing the duplicates away and sending the singular Doctor Strange reeling. Reality and Space pull Doctor Strange forward, Thanos grasping him by the throat once in range. Doctor Strange grabs futilely at Thanos' hand.]

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: You're full of tricks, wizard.

dialogue.speaker: Stephen Strange
dialogue.line: [as Thanos reaches for the Eye of Agamotto] No!

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: [He snaps the Eye off its chain] Yet you never once used your greatest weapon. [He crushes it in his bare hand] A fake. [He throws Doctor Strange hard enough that Doctor Strange's head hits stone and he passes out.]

scene.description: [Almost simultaneously, a red and gold device slaps into the palm of the Infinity Gauntlet, bracing the fingers open; and a red and gold Avenger makes a fast and hard entrance.]

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: [sounding just about done with the Titan] You throw another moon at me, and I'm gonna to lose it.

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: Stark.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
dialogue.line: You know me?

dialogue.speaker: Thanos
dialogue.line: I do. You're not the only one cursed with knowledge.

dialogue.speaker: Tony Stark
